original: gang la de ltar 'jug snyam na /
analyzed: gang la de ltar 'jug snyam na /
translated: elimination of the doubt “What is the meaning of the statement?”🔽The first half of the commentary on the Pramānﬁ avārtika is the🔽elimination of the doubt “What is the meaning of the statement?”🔽The second half of the commentary on the Pramānﬁ avārtika is the🔽elimination of the doubt “What is the meaning of the statement?”

original: mkhas pa'i zhes bya ba'i skabs su bab pa la ngag gi don gang yin zhes dogs pa bzlog pas rnam 'grel gyi phyed snga ma rnam par 'grel ba ni /🔽mig la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mkhas pa'i zhes bya ba'i skabs su bab pa la ngag gi don gang yin zhes dogs pa bzlog pas rnam 'grel gyi phyed snga ma rnam par 'grel ba ni / mig la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The first half of the commentary on the Pramānﬁ avārtika is the🔽elimination of the doubt “What is the meaning of the statement?”

original: phyed phyi ma rnam par 'grel ba ni /
analyzed: phyed phyi ma rnam par 'grel ba ni /
translated: The second half of the commentary on the Pramānﬁ avārtika is the🔽elimination of the doubt “What is the meaning of the statement?”🔽The first half of the commentary on the Pramānﬁ avārtika is the

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: elimination of the doubt “What is the meaning of the statement?”

original: de la te bdag gi don la ltos nas so //
analyzed: de la te bdag gi don la ltos nas so //
translated: The second half of the commentary on the Pramānﬁ avārtika is the

original: de zhes bya ba bdag gi don to //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba bdag gi don to //
translated: elimination of the doubt “What is the meaning of the statement?”🔽The first half of the commentary on the Pramānﬁ avārtika is the

original: 'on te sun 'byin pa 'di ni slob dpon bzhed pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te sun 'byin pa 'di ni slob dpon bzhed pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: elimination of the doubt “What is the meaning of the statement?”🔽The second half of the commentary on the Pramānﬁ avārtika is the

original: slob dpon gyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: elimination of the doubt “What is the meaning of the statement?”🔽The first half of the commentary on the Pramānﬁ avārtika is the🔽elimination of the doubt “What is the meaning of the statement?”🔽The second half of the commentary on the Pramānﬁ avārtika is the

original: ci ltar zhes bya ba ni skabs su bab pa yang ma yin la bsgrub par bya ba yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ci ltar zhes bya ba ni skabs su bab pa yang ma yin la bsgrub par bya ba yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: elimination of the doubt “What is the meaning of the statement?”🔽The first half of the commentary on the Pramānﬁ avārtika is the🔽elimination of the doubt “What is the meaning of the statement?”🔽The second half of the commentary on the Pramānﬁ avā

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni gal te gang la rtsod pas sgrub pa bkod pa'i 'dus pa ma yin pa gzhan gyi don de bsgrub par bya ba ma yin na /
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni gal te gang la rtsod pas sgrub pa bkod pa'i 'dus pa ma yin pa gzhan gyi don de bsgrub par bya ba ma yin na /
translated: “Otherwise” means that if the other’s purpose is not the object to be established, then it is not the assembly that is the subject of the debate.

original: de'i tshe mi 'dod pa 'gal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe mi 'dod pa 'gal bar 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, there would be a contradiction with what is not accepted.

original: 'dus pa gzhan gyi don bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus pa gzhan gyi don bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the other’s purpose is not the object to be established.

original: 'on te nyes pa 'dis 'jigs nas gzhan gyi don byed pa tsam zhig sgrub par byed na /
analyzed: 'on te nyes pa 'dis 'jigs nas gzhan gyi don byed pa tsam zhig sgrub par byed na /
translated: But if, fearing this fault, one establishes only the performance of the other’s purpose,

original: de'i tshe 'bras bu med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'bras bu med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: then it would be pointless.

original: grub pa la bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grub pa la bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would be an establishment of what is already established.

original: gzhan gyi don tsam la ni rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba dag rtsod pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don tsam la ni rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba dag rtsod pa med do //
translated: There is no debate between the proponent and opponent regarding the mere performance of the other’s purpose.

original: gal te de bsgrub par bya ba yin na de'i tshe rgol ba'i mi 'dod pa nyid du 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te de bsgrub par bya ba yin na de'i tshe rgol ba'i mi 'dod pa nyid du 'gyur la /
translated: If that is the object to be established, then it would not be accepted by the opponent.

original: phyir rgol ba la ltos nas ni 'bras bu med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyir rgol ba la ltos nas ni 'bras bu med par 'gyur te /
translated: And in relation to the opponent, it would be pointless,

original: grub pa la bsgrub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dza yanta'i bshad pa'o //
analyzed: grub pa la bsgrub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dza yanta'i bshad pa'o //
translated: because it would be an establishment of what is already established. This is Jayanta’s explanation.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni bdag gi don las gzhan gyi don tsam bsgrub na yang ma 'brel ba de'i phyir na /
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni bdag gi don las gzhan gyi don tsam bsgrub na yang ma 'brel ba de'i phyir na /
translated: The other is the mere accomplishment of the welfare of others, which is not related to one's own welfare.

original: 'ga' yang bsgrub par bya ba ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'ga' yang bsgrub par bya ba ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it would not be accomplished at all.

original: ci ltar gzhan bsgrub par bya ba ma 'brel snyam na /
analyzed: ci ltar gzhan bsgrub par bya ba ma 'brel snyam na /
translated: How is it that the accomplishment of the other is not related?

original: de lta na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus means in that way.

original: bdag gi don dang gzhan gyi don tsam gyi phyogs gnyis grub pa la ltos te'o //
analyzed: bdag gi don dang gzhan gyi don tsam gyi phyogs gnyis grub pa la ltos te'o //
translated: In dependence on the two sides of one's own welfare and the mere welfare of others.

original: de zhes bya ba bdag gi don nyid spangs nas so //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba bdag gi don nyid spangs nas so //
translated: The that refers to one's own welfare.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan tsam bsgrub pa na grub par gyur pas na bdag bsgrub par bya ba ma yin yang 'grub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan tsam bsgrub pa na grub par gyur pas na bdag bsgrub par bya ba ma yin yang 'grub pa yin no //
translated: If one were to abandon that, then, since the mere welfare of others would be accomplished, one's own welfare would not be accomplished, but it would be accomplished.

original: des na bdag dngos su @41b ni bsgrub par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: des na bdag dngos su @41b ni bsgrub par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, one's own welfare is not directly accomplished.

original: des na rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: des na rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i nyes pa med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault of non-pervasion.

original: gzhan ni gzhan gyi don nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan ni gzhan gyi don nyid do //
translated: The other is the mere welfare of others.

original: 'dod 'grub ni bdag gi don 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod 'grub ni bdag gi don 'grub pa'o //
translated: The accomplishment is the accomplishment of one's own welfare.

original: de lta yin na zhes bya ba ni 'dod ba ltar ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na zhes bya ba ni 'dod ba ltar ro //
translated: If it were like that, means if it were as you wish.

original: ci ste kun 'grub snyam na /
analyzed: ci ste kun 'grub snyam na /
translated: If you think that all is established,🔽then, since there is no difference in the near or far, the other is not established.

original: nye ba'i khyad par med pa na gzhan mi 'grub po zhes bya ba de ga las yin te ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: nye ba'i khyad par med pa na gzhan mi 'grub po zhes bya ba de ga las yin te ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: How is that? It is not so.

original: des na 'dod pa bzhin du kun 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na 'dod pa bzhin du kun 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, all is established as one wishes.

original: de lta yin dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de lta yin dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If that is so,

original: phyin ci log grub dang ngo //
analyzed: phyin ci log grub dang ngo //
translated: then error is established.

original: thams cad bsgrub par bya bar thal ba'i lan gyi dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: thams cad bsgrub par bya bar thal ba'i lan gyi dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: The objection that it follows that everything is established is anticipated

original: 'dod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because of the desire.

original: de nyid ni bdag gi don nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid ni bdag gi don nyid do //
translated: That itself is the purpose of the self.

original: gzhan mi 'dod pa ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan mi 'dod pa ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not the non-desire of the other.

original: 'gog ba ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'gog ba ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is not the cessation.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'dod pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because of the desire.

original: bsams pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: bsams pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is the idea:

original: gal te gzhan bsgrub pa na gzhan sgrub par byed pas 'grub par nus na de'i tshe 'dod pas ci bya ste /
analyzed: gal te gzhan bsgrub pa na gzhan sgrub par byed pas 'grub par nus na de'i tshe 'dod pas ci bya ste /
translated: If, when one is established, the other is established by the establishment of the one, then at that time, what is the use of desire?

original: 'dod pas ni gtan tshigs kyi byed pa rnam par dbye bar bya mi nus so zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pas ni gtan tshigs kyi byed pa rnam par dbye bar bya mi nus so zhes bya ba'o //
translated: One cannot divide the function of a reason according to one’s wishes.

original: 'dod pas gtan tshigs kyi byed pa rnam par 'byed par byed pa de lta na yang nyes pa yod pa nyid do zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'dod pas gtan tshigs kyi byed pa rnam par 'byed par byed pa de lta na yang nyes pa yod pa nyid do zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: Even if one does divide the function of a reason according to one’s wishes, there is still a fault. This is what is being said.

original: de ltar yin na ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar yin na ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: “If that were so” means

original: 'dod pas gtan tshigs kyi byed pa rnam par 'byed pa yin na yang ngo //
analyzed: 'dod pas gtan tshigs kyi byed pa rnam par 'byed pa yin na yang ngo //
translated: even if one does divide the function of a reason according to one’s wishes.

original: rgol pa gzhan gyi ldog pa 'grub pa dgag tu med do //
analyzed: rgol pa gzhan gyi ldog pa 'grub pa dgag tu med do //
translated: The establishment of the opposite of the opponent’s position cannot be refuted.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: phyir rgol ba bzlog pa 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyir rgol ba bzlog pa 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one wishes to refute the opponent.

original: 'on te rgol ba'i 'dod pa kho na 'grub kyi gzhan 'god pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rgol ba'i 'dod pa kho na 'grub kyi gzhan 'god pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if the opponent’s position alone is established and not the other,

original: 'dod par zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'dod par zhes smos so //
translated: then one should say “according to one’s wishes.”

original: 'on te gang gis rgol ba'i 'dod pa 'grub par 'gyur ba 'brel pa'i khyad par yod pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gang gis rgol ba'i 'dod pa 'grub par 'gyur ba 'brel pa'i khyad par yod pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: But if there is a specific relation by which the opponent’s position is established,

original: gang gis zhes smos so //
analyzed: gang gis zhes smos so //
translated: then one should say “by which.”

original: de'i phyir gal te gzhan bsgrubs pas gzhan 'grub na de'i tshe thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di gnas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te gzhan bsgrubs pas gzhan 'grub na de'i tshe thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di gnas so //
translated: Therefore, if one thing is established by establishing another, then at that time, it is correct to say that everything would be established.

original: dpe bsgrub byas stong par 'gyur te zhes brjod pa gang yin pa de'i lan ni dogs pa bsu ba ni brjod par 'dod pa'i zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dpe bsgrub byas stong par 'gyur te zhes brjod pa gang yin pa de'i lan ni dogs pa bsu ba ni brjod par 'dod pa'i zhes bya ba ste /
translated: As for the response to the statement, “The example would be empty of the probandum,” the anticipation of an objection is stated in “If one says . . . ”

original: brjod pa'i chos la ltos nas brjod par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: brjod pa'i chos la ltos nas brjod par 'dod pa'o //
translated: The one who wishes to state something is in reliance upon the phenomenon that is stated.

original: lan ni gal te zhes bya ba'o//
analyzed: lan ni gal te zhes bya ba'o//
translated: The response is stated in “If . . . ”

original: 'dir 'di ltar 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir 'di ltar 'dod pa yin te /
translated: Here this is what is intended.

original: gzhan gyis kyang 'gal zhig ni 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs ltar snang bar 'dod pa 'ga' zhig ni khyad par 'gal bar ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyis kyang 'gal zhig ni 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs ltar snang bar 'dod pa 'ga' zhig ni khyad par 'gal bar ro //
translated: Some assert that a contradiction is a contradictory, seemingly correct reason, and some assert that a contradiction is a contradictory attribute.

original: de la gal te brjod pa kho na bsgrub par bya ba yin na de'i smras pa'i chos phyin ci log tu bsgrub pa kho na la 'gal bar 'gyur gyi khyad par 'gal @42a * //🔽ba ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la gal te brjod pa kho na bsgrub par bya ba yin na de'i smras pa'i chos phyin ci log tu bsgrub pa kho na la 'gal bar 'gyur gyi khyad par 'gal @42a * //🔽ba ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In that regard, if the statement itself is the probandum, then the statement of a phenomenon that is the opposite of that is contradictory, but it is not a contradiction of the attribute.

original: de bas na khyad par 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir gzhan gyis kyang ma smras pa yang khas blang dogs so //
analyzed: de bas na khyad par 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir gzhan gyis kyang ma smras pa yang khas blang dogs so //
translated: Therefore, because of the formulation of a fallacious reason that is contradictory with respect to the difference, we fear that others will accept the position that is not stated.

original: gang zhig pha rol pos khyad par 'gal bar brjod pa kho na de 'dod pa la gnod par byed pa'i 'gal bar brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig pha rol pos khyad par 'gal bar brjod pa kho na de 'dod pa la gnod par byed pa'i 'gal bar brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That which is stated by the opponent as contradictory with respect to the difference is stated as a contradiction that harms the thesis.

original: thams cad la zhes bya ba ni sgrub byed yang dag pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: thams cad la zhes bya ba ni sgrub byed yang dag pa la yang ngo //
translated: “ In all cases” means in the case of a correct proof.

original: gtan tshigs ltar snang gi dbang du byas te brjod pa ni brjod pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ltar snang gi dbang du byas te brjod pa ni brjod pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “ Stated” is stated with respect to a fallacious reason.

original: 'o na ci ltar khyad par 'gal ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar khyad par 'gal ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is it contradictory with respect to the difference?

original: khyad par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is called a difference.

original: gzhan du smras pa la ltos nas ni khyad par dang 'gal ba nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du smras pa la ltos nas ni khyad par dang 'gal ba nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no contradiction with respect to the difference in dependence on the statement of the other.

original: de'i phyir brjod bar 'dod pa'i chos rjes su 'gro ba med pas ni nyes par 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i phyir dpe thams cad bsgrub bya ma tshang bar 'gyur ro zhes gnas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir brjod bar 'dod pa'i chos rjes su 'gro ba med pas ni nyes par 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i phyir dpe thams cad bsgrub bya ma tshang bar 'gyur ro zhes gnas so //
translated: Therefore, since the property to be proven is not concomitant with the reason, all examples are incomplete because they have the fault of nonconcomitance.

original: rjes su 'gro ba med pa dang 'gal ba'i nyes pa gzhan la yang bsgre ba ni /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba med pa dang 'gal ba'i nyes pa gzhan la yang bsgre ba ni /
translated: The fault of nonconcomitance can be extended to other cases:

original: 'dis ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is stated.

original: 'on te bsgrub par bya ba gang yang rung bas gnyis pa dang bcas pa tsam gyi spyir 'dod kyi /
analyzed: 'on te bsgrub par bya ba gang yang rung bas gnyis pa dang bcas pa tsam gyi spyir 'dod kyi /
translated: If you assert that the mere presence of a second thing is the reason,

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i skyes bus gnyis pa dang bcas pa nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i skyes bus gnyis pa dang bcas pa nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: then the mere presence of a second thing is not the person who has that form.

original: des na rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i skyon med dam snyam na /
analyzed: des na rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i skyon med dam snyam na /
translated: Therefore, you may think that the fault of nonconcomitance does not occur.

original: lan btab pa ni gang yang rung bas gnyis pa dang bcas pa de nyid ni rnam pa de lta bu'i lus mi 'gyur na te lus dor na 'grub pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lan btab pa ni gang yang rung bas gnyis pa dang bcas pa de nyid ni rnam pa de lta bu'i lus mi 'gyur na te lus dor na 'grub pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The response is: If the mere presence of a second thing is the reason, then the mere presence of a second thing is not the body that has that form. It is not the body that is discarded.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: don gsal ba gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gsal ba gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no other thing that is clear.

original: gnyi ga las gcig dor na gang yang rung ba'i spyi 'grub pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga las gcig dor na gang yang rung ba'i spyi 'grub pa ni ma yin no //
translated: If one of the two is rejected, then the establishment of either is not possible.

original: des na tshu rol mdzes pa brjod byas stong pa brjod pa rnams kyi /
analyzed: des na tshu rol mdzes pa brjod byas stong pa brjod pa rnams kyi /
translated: Therefore, the proponents of the doctrine of the beauty of this shore, who are empty of speech,

original: gnyis pa dang bcas pa'i sgrub par byed pa nyid ni 'di de ni mi shes kyi bslang yin te ma 'brel pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnyis pa dang bcas pa'i sgrub par byed pa nyid ni 'di de ni mi shes kyi bslang yin te ma 'brel pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: say that the probative argument is not double, but this is not so; it is not connected, is the meaning.

original: gang la rjes su 'gro ba med pa la sogs pa'i nyes par 'gyur ba gnyis pa dang bcas pa'i sbyor ba de yang gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang la rjes su 'gro ba med pa la sogs pa'i nyes par 'gyur ba gnyis pa dang bcas pa'i sbyor ba de yang gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that probative argument which has a double fault, such as the absence of concomitance?

original: 'di ltar zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes smos so //
translated: He says, “thus.”

original: lus gang la mngon par gsal ba'i sems pa yod pa'i lus de'i mtshan nyid skyes bus gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: lus gang la mngon par gsal ba'i sems pa yod pa'i lus de'i mtshan nyid skyes bus gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The body in which the volition is manifest is the body whose characteristic is the person. That is what is meant by “thus.”

original: bum pa ni de lta bu'i skyes bu dang / bum pa de dag las gang yang rung bas gnyis pa dang bcas pa yin te'o //
analyzed: bum pa ni de lta bu'i skyes bu dang / bum pa de dag las gang yang rung bas gnyis pa dang bcas pa yin te'o //
translated: The pot is the person of that sort, and the pot is double, either one or the other.

original: shugs kyis na bum pa ni de lta bu'i skyes bus gnyis pa dang bcas par 'dod pa yin gyi brjod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: shugs kyis na bum pa ni de lta bu'i skyes bus gnyis pa dang bcas par 'dod pa yin gyi brjod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: By implication, the pot is asserted to be accompanied by such a person, but not by expression,

original: rjes 'gro med pa'i nyes pas 'jigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes 'gro med pa'i nyes pas 'jigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the fault of not being a universal.

original: sbyor ba 'di nyid 'chad pa ni skyes bu ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba 'di nyid 'chad pa ni skyes bu ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This very syllogism is stated in the line “The person . . . ”

original: @42b rigs pa can la sogs pas mngon par 'dod pa'i bdag la sogs pa ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: @42b rigs pa can la sogs pas mngon par 'dod pa'i bdag la sogs pa ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not the self and so on that are asserted by the Naiyāyikas and so on.

original: de la yang zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba 'jig rten pha rol can ma yin pa'i skyes bu la'o //
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba 'jig rten pha rol can ma yin pa'i skyes bu la'o //
translated: “ In that” refers to the probandum, the person who does not have a next life.

original: gtan tshigs ni /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ni /
translated: The reason is

original: autpala ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: autpala ma yin pa'o //
translated: “not a lotus.”

original: bsam pa ni rgyang 'phen pa'i'o //
analyzed: bsam pa ni rgyang 'phen pa'i'o //
translated: The intention is that of the Lokāyata.

original: de lta bu zhes bya ba ni mngon par gsal ba'i mtshan nyid 'jig rten pha rol can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu zhes bya ba ni mngon par gsal ba'i mtshan nyid 'jig rten pha rol can ma yin pa'o //
translated: “ Such” refers to the characteristic of manifest phenomena that do not have a next life.

original: de lta bu'i skyes bus gnyis pa dang bcas pa nyid du dngos su ci ste mi bsgrub snyam na /
analyzed: de lta bu'i skyes bus gnyis pa dang bcas pa nyid du dngos su ci ste mi bsgrub snyam na /
translated: Why does he not explicitly prove that the pot is accompanied by such a person?

original: thabs yin no zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: thabs yin no zhes bya ba ste /
translated: He says, “The method . . . ”

original: dngos dang phal pa'i bsam pas ci zhig bya ste rnam par gang yang rung ba'i sgo nas autpala ma yin pa la sogs pa ni bsgrub bya 'grub pa'i thabs yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: dngos dang phal pa'i bsam pas ci zhig bya ste rnam par gang yang rung ba'i sgo nas autpala ma yin pa la sogs pa ni bsgrub bya 'grub pa'i thabs yin no zhe'o //
translated: What is the use of the idea of the real and the ordinary? By any means whatsoever, the non-lotus, etc., is the means of establishing the probandum.

original: gcig tu nges par 'gog pa'i don yin mod de lta na yang 'di la sngar brjod pa'i skyon ci ltar yod snyam na /
analyzed: gcig tu nges par 'gog pa'i don yin mod de lta na yang 'di la sngar brjod pa'i skyon ci ltar yod snyam na /
translated: Although the meaning is definitely a negation, still, how can there be the fault mentioned above in this case?

original: 'di ltar zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes smos so //
translated: Thus, he says, “in this way.”

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gang yang rung bas gnyis pa dang bcas pa nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gang yang rung bas gnyis pa dang bcas pa nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba yin la /
translated: “Or” means that by any means whatsoever, the mere presence of a second is the probandum.

original: de grub pas kyang khyad par skyes bu bsgrub par bya ba ma yin yang 'grub pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de grub pas kyang khyad par skyes bu bsgrub par bya ba ma yin yang 'grub pa yin gyi /
translated: And by establishing that, the particular person is established, although not the probandum.

original: khyad par can gyi skyes bu'i rnag bzhin de ni bsgrub par bya ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par can gyi skyes bu'i rnag bzhin de ni bsgrub par bya ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But the particular person, that is, the nature of the person, is not the probandum.

original: 'di la lan ni /
analyzed: 'di la lan ni /
translated: The answer to this is:

original: de'i tshe yang zhes bya ba'o //🔽bstan zin pa ni /
analyzed: de'i tshe yang zhes bya ba'o // bstan zin pa ni /
translated: “Even then,” etc.

original: gal te gzhan grub na yang bsgrub bya min zhes bya ba der ro //
analyzed: gal te gzhan grub na yang bsgrub bya min zhes bya ba der ro //
translated: “Already stated” is in the statement, “Even if the other is established, it is not the probandum.”

original: bsgrub par bya ba spyir 'dod na zhes bya ba rnam par 'grel pa ni /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba spyir 'dod na zhes bya ba rnam par 'grel pa ni /
translated: The commentary on the passage “If a universal is to be established in general” is as follows.

original: 'dir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The passage “Here . . . ”

original: gang yang rung ba nyid kyi spyi bsgrub par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: gang yang rung ba nyid kyi spyi bsgrub par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: is a reply to the question, “Why is it not established as a universal that is either a particular or a general characteristic?”

original: rnam pa de 'dra ba'i skyes bu 'phangs pa ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa de 'dra ba'i skyes bu 'phangs pa ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not established as a universal that is either a particular or a general characteristic.

original: de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa rnam par 'grel pas lan 'debs pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa rnam par 'grel pas lan 'debs pa ni /
translated: The commentary on the passage “That . . . ”

original: de ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: is the passage “That . . . ”🔽The passage “Even if a particular . . . ”

original: gsal ba zhig kyang zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
analyzed: gsal ba zhig kyang zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
translated: is a doubt.

original: gal te gsal pa zhig kyang spyi mi 'jig na /🔽de'i tshe gsal bas stong pa'i yul du yang ci ste yod par tha snyad mi byed snyam na /
analyzed: gal te gsal pa zhig kyang spyi mi 'jig na / de'i tshe gsal bas stong pa'i yul du yang ci ste yod par tha snyad mi byed snyam na /
translated: If even a particular does not destroy the universal,🔽then why do you not call it existent in a place that is empty of a particular?

original: gsal bar byed pa zhes smras so //
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa zhes smras so //
translated: The reply is “It is not a universal that is manifested by a particular.”

original: lan ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reply is “It is not a reply.”

original: 'dir ni skyes bu la'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni skyes bu la'o //
translated: Here, the reply is to the question about a person.

original: ci ltar med snyam na de lta bu'i zhes smos so //
analyzed: ci ltar med snyam na de lta bu'i zhes smos so //
translated: How is it nonexistent? The passage “It is not . . . ”🔽is a reply to that question.

original: de bzhin du gang yang rung pa'i spyi yang tha snyad kyi yul ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gang yang rung pa'i spyi yang tha snyad kyi yul ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, any universal is not an object of designation.

original: des na des khyab pa ci ltar 'grub ma mthong ba'i mes du ba la khyab pa ni gang du yang rtogs pa med do //
analyzed: des na des khyab pa ci ltar 'grub ma mthong ba'i mes du ba la khyab pa ni gang du yang rtogs pa med do //
translated: Therefore, we do not see how the pervasion can be established. The pervasion of fire by smoke is not understood anywhere.

original: tshad ma 'di nyid las zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu ba ste autpala ma yin pa'i rtags las so //
analyzed: tshad ma 'di nyid las zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu ba ste autpala ma yin pa'i rtags las so //
translated: From this very means of valid knowledge means anticipating an objection, from the sign of not being a lotus.

original: lan ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is no.

original: khyab pa'i dus na spyi yod par grub na rjes su dpog pa @43a * //
analyzed: khyab pa'i dus na spyi yod par grub na rjes su dpog pa @43a * //
translated: When the pervasion is established, if the universal is established, then there is inference.

original: yin no // ci ltar na khyab pa'i dus su spyi ma grub na gang gis phan tshun bden pa'i nyes par 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: yin no // ci ltar na khyab pa'i dus su spyi ma grub na gang gis phan tshun bden pa'i nyes par 'gyur snyam na /
translated: How, when the pervasion is not established, can there be a fault of mutual contradiction?

original: ma grub pa la ni zhes smos te /🔽khyad par ma grub pa la ni spyi'i rnam pa srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma grub pa la ni zhes smos te / khyad par ma grub pa la ni spyi'i rnam pa srid pa ma yin no //
translated: It is said in the non-established.🔽 In the non-established particular, the form of the universal is not possible.

original: khyad par dang bral ba'i spyi ni med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khyad par dang bral ba'i spyi ni med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is no universal devoid of particulars.

original: gtan tshigs ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni sgra mi rtag pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba la sogs pa dang mthun phyogs gang rung yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gtan tshigs ma yin pa de bzhin du autpala ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs kyis bsgrub par bya
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni sgra mi rtag pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba la sogs pa dang mthun phyogs gang rung yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gtan tshigs ma yin pa de bzhin du autpala ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs kyis bsgrub par bya
translated: The so-called non-reason is like the reason, “because of being a sound,” in the proof of sound as impermanent, etc. and is a non-reason because it is a similar instance.

original: ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: ba yang ma yin no //
translated: Likewise, the reason, “because of not being a lotus,” in the proof of sound as impermanent is also not a similar instance.

original: ci'i phyir gtan tshigs ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gtan tshigs ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it a non-reason?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is like this.

original: ci ltar sgra la med snyam na /
analyzed: ci ltar sgra la med snyam na /
translated: If one thinks, “How is it that it does not exist in sound?”

original: sgra la zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sgra la zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is said, “in sound.”

original: 'gal ba med pa ma yin pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'gal ba med pa ma yin pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: because of the contradiction of the non-contradictory.

original: 'gal ba nyid brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'gal ba nyid brjod pa ni /
translated: The contradiction itself is stated:

original: gang yang rung ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gang yang rung ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: “either one or the other.”

original: 'di ltar ram yang na 'di ltar zhes rnam par rtog pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir chos can sgra la gnyi ga ni 'gal lo //
analyzed: 'di ltar ram yang na 'di ltar zhes rnam par rtog pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir chos can sgra la gnyi ga ni 'gal lo //
translated: Because it is the object of conceptual thought, “in this way” or “in that way,” both are contradictory in the subject, sound.

original: de la ni phyogs kho na yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la ni phyogs kho na yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There, only the position exists.

original: gal te phyogs kho na yod mod de lta na yang de las gzhan nye bar dgong par 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: gal te phyogs kho na yod mod de lta na yang de las gzhan nye bar dgong par 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: If you say that the reason is present, but that the example is not similar,

original: nges pa'i chos zhes smos so //🔽gzhal bya 'gal bar brjod nas /
analyzed: nges pa'i chos zhes smos so // gzhal bya 'gal bar brjod nas /
translated: then the author of the treatise says, “the property of the thesis.”🔽Having stated the contradiction in the object of evaluation,

original: sgra 'gal bar brjod pa ni /
analyzed: sgra 'gal bar brjod pa ni /
translated: he states the contradiction in the word:

original: gzhan zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “other.”

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni gang yang rung bsgrub byed dam bsgrub bya yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni gang yang rung bsgrub byed dam bsgrub bya yin pa'o //
translated: “This” means that which is to be established or the thesis.

original: snam bu zhes bya ba ni bum pa chos can du byed pa dor nas snam bu nyid chos can du byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: snam bu zhes bya ba ni bum pa chos can du byed pa dor nas snam bu nyid chos can du byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Cloth” means that having abandoned the pot as the subject, the cloth itself becomes the subject. This is the meaning.

original: spyir zhes bya ba ni gal te bum pa chos can ma yin na'o //
analyzed: spyir zhes bya ba ni gal te bum pa chos can ma yin na'o //
translated: “In general” means if the pot is not the subject.

original: nyes pa 'di nyid ces bya ba ni grub pa la bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: nyes pa 'di nyid ces bya ba ni grub pa la bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: “This fault” is the characteristic of establishing what has already been established.

original: de zhes bya ba rnam pa de 'dra ba'i skyes bu mi 'phen na'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba rnam pa de 'dra ba'i skyes bu mi 'phen na'o //
translated: “That” means that if a person of that kind is not indicated.

original: 'bras bu ci yin zhes bya ba ni grub pa la bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu ci yin zhes bya ba ni grub pa la bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “What is the result?” means because of establishing what has already been established.

original: mi 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni bzlog pa bsgrub pa las so //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni bzlog pa bsgrub pa las so //
translated: The term “undesired” is from the proof of the opposite.

original: gnyi gar zhes bya ba ni bum pa ni skyes bu dang bum pa gang yang rung bas zhes bum pa lan gnyis bkod pa'o //
analyzed: gnyi gar zhes bya ba ni bum pa ni skyes bu dang bum pa gang yang rung bas zhes bum pa lan gnyis bkod pa'o //
translated: “ Both” is the repetition of the term “pot” in “the pot is produced by the person” and “the pot is produced by the potter.”

original: 'dar ni sbyor ba la'o //
analyzed: 'dar ni sbyor ba la'o //
translated: “ Or” is in the compound.

original: rang gi tshig dang 'gal lo zhes bya ba ni gang yang rung ba smos pas ni ma nges par bstan la /
analyzed: rang gi tshig dang 'gal lo zhes bya ba ni gang yang rung ba smos pas ni ma nges par bstan la /
translated: “ Contradicts your own words” means that the term “or” indicates uncertainty,

original: bsgrub bya zhes bya ba la ni nges par ro //
analyzed: bsgrub bya zhes bya ba la ni nges par ro //
translated: but the term “the probandum” indicates certainty.

original: 'di nyid gzhung 'dzugs pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid gzhung 'dzugs pa ni /
translated: This is the establishment of the thesis.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “ Thus” is the conclusion.

original: 'on te de lta na yang gang yang rung ba brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'on te de lta na yang gang yang rung ba brjod pa ni /
translated: “ But if it is like that, the expression ‘or’

original: nges pa las bzlog pa ston par byed pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: nges pa las bzlog pa ston par byed pa yin no snyam na /
translated: teaches the opposite of certainty.”

original: gal te gnyi @43b gar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te gnyi @43b gar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “ If it is both” is the response.

original: de las te nges pa las bzlog pa bsgrub pa ci ltar de ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de las te nges pa las bzlog pa bsgrub pa ci ltar de ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: How could the proof of the opposite of that, certainty, be anything but that?

original: pha rol pos ma yin te zhes smras so //
analyzed: pha rol pos ma yin te zhes smras so //
translated: The opponent says, “No.”

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra ba tshu rol mdzes pa pa la 'dri ba ni /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra ba tshu rol mdzes pa pa la 'dri ba ni /
translated: The proponent of the thesis asks the Lokāyata:

original: ci ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “How?”

original: gzhan gyi lan ni shugs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi lan ni shugs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reply of the other is “implication.”

original: grub pa'i mtha' pa rnam par brtag pa byas nas sun 'byin pa ni shugs de zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' pa rnam par brtag pa byas nas sun 'byin pa ni shugs de zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Having analyzed the philosophical position, the refutation is “implication.”

original: gtan tshigs kyi zhes bya ba ni autpala ma yin pa'i'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi zhes bya ba ni autpala ma yin pa'i'o //
translated: “Reason” is “not a lotus.”

original: tshig gi ni autpala ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i'o //
analyzed: tshig gi ni autpala ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i'o //
translated: “Word” is “because it is not a lotus.”

original: ma nges pa nyid brjod pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma nges pa nyid brjod pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The expression of uncertainty is “thus.”

original: gzhan yang ni 'jig rten pha rol dang ldan pa'i skyes bu yang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan yang ni 'jig rten pha rol dang ldan pa'i skyes bu yang ngo //
translated: “Moreover” is “a person who possesses another world.”

original: phyogs gnyis pa 'gog pa ni /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa 'gog pa ni /
translated: The second position is refuted:

original: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “But if . . .”

original: za zhes bya ba 'dis ni za ba'i don brjod par 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: za zhes bya ba 'dis ni za ba'i don brjod par 'dod pa yin no //
translated: By “eats,” the meaning of “eats” is intended.

original: 'on te rnam pa de lta bu'i skyes bus gnyis pa la rjes su 'gro ba grub na /
analyzed: 'on te rnam pa de lta bu'i skyes bus gnyis pa la rjes su 'gro ba grub na /
translated: But if the existence of a person of that kind is established by the second,

original: sbyor ba yang de kho na ltar bstan par bya'o zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: sbyor ba yang de kho na ltar bstan par bya'o zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: the application should be taught just like that.

original: gal te bum pa bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te bum pa bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is said, “Like a pot . . .”

original: bum pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni ci ltar chos can bum pa tshad mas grub pa ltar ro //
analyzed: bum pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni ci ltar chos can bum pa tshad mas grub pa ltar ro //
translated: “Like a pot” means just as a pot, the subject, is established by a valid cognition.

original: khyab pa 'dzin pa'i dus su tshad mas sgrub par byed pa'i khyab par byed pa nyid du thob pa ste nges pa'i yod pa nyid gal yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: khyab pa 'dzin pa'i dus su tshad mas sgrub par byed pa'i khyab par byed pa nyid du thob pa ste nges pa'i yod pa nyid gal yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: When the pervasion is apprehended, the pervader is established by a valid cognition, and the existence that is ascertained is called “established by a valid cognition.”

original: tshig ces bya ba ni gang autpala ma yin pa de ni rnam pa de lta bu'i skyes bus gnyis pa dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: tshig ces bya ba ni gang autpala ma yin pa de ni rnam pa de lta bu'i skyes bus gnyis pa dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rang bzhin no //
translated: “ Words” means that which is not a blue lotus is of that kind, i.e., it is associated with a second.

original: 'di nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni mngon par gsal ba'i sems pa can zhes bya ba la sogs pa nyid kyis so //🔽de lta yin na skyes bu bsgrub par bya ba la yang /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni mngon par gsal ba'i sems pa can zhes bya ba la sogs pa nyid kyis so // de lta yin na skyes bu bsgrub par bya ba la yang /
translated: “ By this alone” means by the mere fact that it is a mental state that is clearly manifest.🔽If that were the case, then the refutation that was stated in the proof of the person

original: sun 'byin pa brjod pa gang yin pa de rnam rtog mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sun 'byin pa brjod pa gang yin pa de rnam rtog mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: would be equivalent to a doubt.

original: sgra dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rtsod pa rjes su brjod nas sun 'byin pa ni /
analyzed: sgra dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rtsod pa rjes su brjod nas sun 'byin pa ni /
translated: Having stated the objection, the response is as follows:

original: ma yin zhes bya ba ste mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: ma yin zhes bya ba ste mtshungs pa'o //
translated: “No” is the same.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: dpe la 'jig pa grub pas sgra 'jigs pa de dang ldan par bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpe la 'jig pa grub pas sgra 'jigs pa de dang ldan par bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the example is established as being destroyed, and sound is established as having that destruction.

original: ci ltar 'jig pa sngar grub pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ci ltar 'jig pa sngar grub pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as destruction is established first,

original: rtsig pa la sogs pa don gzhan la de lta bu'i skyes bu sngar grub pa yod pa yin na bum pa'ang de lta bu'i skyes bu de dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtsig pa la sogs pa don gzhan la de lta bu'i skyes bu sngar grub pa yod pa yin na bum pa'ang de lta bu'i skyes bu de dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: so too, if a pot existed as a different object from a wall, etc., and as having a person who is established in that way, then the pot would have that kind of person.

original: ngag gi zhes bya ba ni bum pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ngag gi shugs kyis thob pa'i'o //
analyzed: ngag gi zhes bya ba ni bum pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ngag gi shugs kyis thob pa'i'o //
translated: “By the power of speech” means that it is obtained by the power of speech, such as “The pot is . . .”

original: de bzhin du mi rtag pa sgrub par byed pa la khyab par ma grub po zhes bya ba 'di ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du mi rtag pa sgrub par byed pa la khyab par ma grub po zhes bya ba 'di ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Similarly, it is not the case that the pervasion is not established in the proof of sound as impermanent.

original: 'on kyang grub pa kho na'o zhes bya @44a * //
analyzed: 'on kyang grub pa kho na'o zhes bya @44a * //
translated: Rather, it is established.

original: pa'i don to //
analyzed: pa'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: 'di ni bsgrub bya'i sgo nas brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni bsgrub bya'i sgo nas brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is stated from the perspective of the probandum.

original: sgrub par byed pa'i sgo nas brjod pa ni /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i sgo nas brjod pa ni /
translated: Stated from the perspective of the proof, it is as follows.

original: de bzhin du ci ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ci ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Just as . . .”

original: ci ltar phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs las gang yang rung ba nyid ma grub pa de bzhin du byas pa nyid kyang ma grub po zhes bya ba de ni ma yin no zhes 'brel to ;
analyzed: ci ltar phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs las gang yang rung ba nyid ma grub pa de bzhin du byas pa nyid kyang ma grub po zhes bya ba de ni ma yin no zhes 'brel to ;
translated: Just as the property of being a non-establishment of any one of the homogeneous and heterogeneous is not established, so too, the property of being a product is not established.

original: / ci ltar mi rtag pa nyid bsgrub snyam na /🔽snga na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: / ci ltar mi rtag pa nyid bsgrub snyam na / snga na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: How is impermanence to be established?🔽The response is “If it existed previously.”🔽The objection is “If it existed previously, then it would not be impermanent.”

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rtsod pa'o //🔽de dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rtsod pa'o // de dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: The response is “If it did not exist previously, then it would not be impermanent.”

original: rjes su 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'o //
translated: The objection is “If it existed previously and also did not exist previously, then it would be impermanent.”

original: bum pa gzhan dang sgra gzhan ci ltar 'dra ba 'grub par 'gyur /🔽bum pa dang sgra dag la mi rtag pa nyid rjes su 'gro ba na 'dra ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: bum pa gzhan dang sgra gzhan ci ltar 'dra ba 'grub par 'gyur / bum pa dang sgra dag la mi rtag pa nyid rjes su 'gro ba na 'dra ba yin no zhe na /
translated: The response is “If it both existed previously and also did not exist previously, then it would be impermanent.”🔽The response is “If it existed previously and also did not exist previously, then it would be impermanent.”🔽The objection is “If it both existed previously and also did not exist previously, then it would be impermanent.”🔽The response is “If it both existed previously and also did not exist previously, then it would be impermanent.”🔽The objection is “If it both existed previously and also did not exist previously, then it would be impermanent.”

original: de yin na 'o na rtsig pa dang bum pa dag kyang gang yang rung bas gnyis pa dang bcas pa tsam gyis rjes su 'gro ba skyes bu yang 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yin na 'o na rtsig pa dang bum pa dag kyang gang yang rung bas gnyis pa dang bcas pa tsam gyis rjes su 'gro ba skyes bu yang 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: The response is “If it both existed previously and also did not exist previously, then it would be impermanent.”🔽The objection is “If it both existed previously and also did not exist previously, then it would be impermanent.”🔽The response is “If it both existed previously and also did not exist previously, then it would be impermanent.”🔽The objection is “If it both existed previously and also did not exist previously, then it would be impermanent.”🔽The response is “If it both existed previously and also did not exist previously, then it would be impermanent.”🔽The objection is “If it both existed previously and also did not exist previously, then it would be impermanent.”🔽The response is “If it both existed previously and also did not exist previously, then it would be impermanent.”🔽The objection is “If it both existed previously and also did not exist previously, then it would be impermanent.”🔽The response is “If it both existed previously and also did not exist previously, then it would be impermanent.”🔽The objection is “If it both existed previously and also did not exist previously, then it would be impermanent.”🔽The response is “If it both existed previously and also did not exist previously, then it would be impermanent.”🔽The objection is “If it both existed previously and also did

original: de'i grub pa'i mtha' smra ba'i lan don med do //
analyzed: de'i grub pa'i mtha' smra ba'i lan don med do //
translated: The response of the proponents of that philosophical tenet is meaningless.

original: gzhan nyid yin pa kho nas 'dra bar 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: gzhan nyid yin pa kho nas 'dra bar 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: It is only because of being different that there is similarity.

original: de lta ma yin te //
analyzed: de lta ma yin te //
translated: If it were not so,

original: gzhan nyid ma yin na 'dra ba de ci ltar yin /
analyzed: gzhan nyid ma yin na 'dra ba de ci ltar yin /
translated: how could there be similarity if there were not difference?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gcig la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gcig la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said, “in one.”

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'dra ba nyid sbyor bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'dra ba nyid sbyor bar byed pa'o //
translated: In this way, he connects similarity.

original: de ni rnam pa de lta bu'i skyes bu dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rnam pa de lta bu'i skyes bu dang ldan pa'o //
translated: That is the person who possesses that kind of form.

original: 'dir zhes bya ba ni gang byas pa de ni mi rtag go zhes bya ba'i sbyor pa la'o //
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba ni gang byas pa de ni mi rtag go zhes bya ba'i sbyor pa la'o //
translated: Here, in the connection, “that which is produced is impermanent,”

original: mi rtag pa nyid rjes su 'gro bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid rjes su 'gro bar 'gyur na /
translated: if impermanence is what is to be proven,

original: chos can gyi khyad par can du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: chos can gyi khyad par can du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: it becomes a particular property of the subject.

original: 'di ga las she na bsgrub par bya ba ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ga las she na bsgrub par bya ba ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: From where? It is said, “the probandum.”

original: sngar zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pa 'god pa'i sngar ro //
analyzed: sngar zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pa 'god pa'i sngar ro //
translated: Previously is prior to the statement of the proof.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
translated: If is a doubt.

original: 'ba' zhig ces bya ba ni chos can gyi rnam par ma dpyad pa rjes su 'gro bas /
analyzed: 'ba' zhig ces bya ba ni chos can gyi rnam par ma dpyad pa rjes su 'gro bas /
translated: “Only” means that the subject is not analyzed, and is accepted as it is known in the world.

original: chos can gyi khyad par can gyi mi rtag pa nyid ci ltar 'grub /
analyzed: chos can gyi khyad par can gyi mi rtag pa nyid ci ltar 'grub /
translated: How can impermanence be established as a property of the subject?

original: gzhan dang ni 'ba' zhig pa dang / gzhan 'grub na zhes bya ba ma 'brel pa bzhin du 'grub na ni'o //
analyzed: gzhan dang ni 'ba' zhig pa dang / gzhan 'grub na zhes bya ba ma 'brel pa bzhin du 'grub na ni'o //
translated: If it were established as “only” and “other,” then it would be established as unrelated to “other” and “only.”

original: de lta na ni zhes bya ba ni thams cad bsgrub bya yin na'o //
analyzed: de lta na ni zhes bya ba ni thams cad bsgrub bya yin na'o //
translated: “In that case” means that if everything is the predicate,

original: sangs rgyas pa'i dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa'i dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: the opponent’s objection is anticipated.

original: smras pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: smras pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “It is said” is the opponent’s objection.

original: skyon 'dir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs 'gal ba dang dpe bsgrub bya ma tshang par ro //
analyzed: skyon 'dir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs 'gal ba dang dpe bsgrub bya ma tshang par ro //
translated: “This error” is the error of the reason being contradictory and the example being incomplete.

original: gzhan la zhes bya ba ni ma smras pa'i chos bsgrub pa la'o //
analyzed: gzhan la zhes bya ba ni ma smras pa'i chos bsgrub pa la'o //
translated: “In the case of other” means in the case of proving a property that is not stated.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis sun 'byin no //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis sun 'byin no //
translated: “No, it is not” is the opponent’s refutation.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' smras pas gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' smras pas gsungs pa'o //
translated: “No, it is not” is the proponent of the tenets’ response.

original: skyes bu 'grub pa la yang de ltar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: skyes bu 'grub pa la yang de ltar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: “The same would apply to the establishment of a person.”

original: @44b skyes bu bsgrub pa la ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: @44b skyes bu bsgrub pa la ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “In the case of establishing a person” means in the case of establishing a person as the object of the action.

original: des kyang zhes bya ba ni gang yang rung bas gnyis pa dang bcas pas kyang mtshungs pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des kyang zhes bya ba ni gang yang rung bas gnyis pa dang bcas pas kyang mtshungs pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “By that” means that even if it is by any one of the two, it is not the same.

original: 'dir ni zhes bya ba ni rgyang 'phan pa'i sbyor ba la ni'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni zhes bya ba ni rgyang 'phan pa'i sbyor ba la ni'o //
translated: “Here” means in the case of the application of the Dārṣṭāntika.

original: gal te so sor zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: gal te so sor zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: “If it is individual” is the opponent’s position.

original: len ni 'dir zhes bya ba ste lhas byin dang mchod sbyin dag las gang yang rung ba la zas byin cig ces bya bar ro //
analyzed: len ni 'dir zhes bya ba ste lhas byin dang mchod sbyin dag las gang yang rung ba la zas byin cig ces bya bar ro //
translated: “Here” means in the case of “Give food to Devadatta or Yajñadatta.”

original: de yang ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: de yang ni nges pa'o //
translated: “That” is the conclusion.

original: mngon sum gyis zhes bya ba ni tshig tsam gyi byed pa nyams par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis zhes bya ba ni tshig tsam gyi byed pa nyams par byed pa'o //
translated: “By direct perception” means that the mere words are invalidated.

original: dngos po'i shugs kyis zhes bya ba ni 'bras chan la sogs pa gnyi gas bza' ba'i yul ma yin pa rung ba la sogs pa de'i shugs kyis skyes bu gcig kho na la bzar gzhug par nges pa yin gyi lhas byin dang mchod sbyin dag las gang yang
analyzed: dngos po'i shugs kyis zhes bya ba ni 'bras chan la sogs pa gnyi gas bza' ba'i yul ma yin pa rung ba la sogs pa de'i shugs kyis skyes bu gcig kho na la bzar gzhug par nges pa yin gyi lhas byin dang mchod sbyin dag las gang yang
translated: The power of the thing is that the object of food, such as boiled rice, is suitable for both to eat, but the power of the words of the master is that it is certain that only one person will eat it, not either Devadatta or Yajñadatta.

original: rung ba la zan byin cig ces bya ba'i tshig gi shugs kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rung ba la zan byin cig ces bya ba'i tshig gi shugs kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not by the power of the words, “Give food to either Devadatta or Yajñadatta.”

original: rje bos gang yang rung ba la zan byin cig ces brjod pas khol po nan gyis 'jug pa ni ma yin la /
analyzed: rje bos gang yang rung ba la zan byin cig ces brjod pas khol po nan gyis 'jug pa ni ma yin la /
translated: When the master says, “Give food to either one,” the servant does not engage in giving food out of compulsion.

original: zab po yang 'jug pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: zab po yang 'jug pa ma yin zhing /
translated: Nor does the servant engage in giving food out of fear.

original: byin cig ces brjod pas ster ba po 'jug pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: byin cig ces brjod pas ster ba po 'jug pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor does the giver engage in giving food out of the words, “Give.”

original: gsum ka yang rnag gi 'dod pas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsum ka yang rnag gi 'dod pas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all three engage in giving out of their own desire.

original: 'di ltar rje pos gang yang rung ba la bzhas ba drongs shig ces smras kyang snyom las kyis zan 'dren pa la mi 'jug la /
analyzed: 'di ltar rje pos gang yang rung ba la bzhas ba drongs shig ces smras kyang snyom las kyis zan 'dren pa la mi 'jug la /
translated: In this way, even though the master says, “Bring food for either one,” the servant does not engage in bringing food out of laziness.

original: za ba po yang na pa la sogs pa'i dbang gis zab la 'jug pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: za ba po yang na pa la sogs pa'i dbang gis zab la 'jug pa ma yin zhing /
translated: The eater also does not engage in eating by the power of being summoned,

original: bslangs kyang gtong ba po gtong ba la mi 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bslangs kyang gtong ba po gtong ba la mi 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: and the summoner does not engage in summoning even if summoned.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zab po'am zhes smos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zab po'am zhes smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, “or the giver,”

original: zab po'am ster ba po rang gi 'dod pas 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: zab po'am ster ba po rang gi 'dod pas 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes 'brel to //
translated: because the giver engages in giving by his own desire.

original: 'dir yang zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa dang bcas pa'i sbyor ba la yang ngo //
analyzed: 'dir yang zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa dang bcas pa'i sbyor ba la yang ngo //
translated: Here, “also” means also in the application with a second.

original: sgrub par byed pa'i zhes bya ba ni autpala ma yin pa la sogs pa'i'o //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i zhes bya ba ni autpala ma yin pa la sogs pa'i'o //
translated: “The proof” is of the non-utpala, etc.

original: bzlog pa la yang zhes bya ba ni de 'dra ba'i skyes bu med pa la autpala ma yin pa nyid srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzlog pa la yang zhes bya ba ni de 'dra ba'i skyes bu med pa la autpala ma yin pa nyid srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Also in the opposite” means that non-existence of such a person is possible for the non-utpala, etc.

original: 'dis ni zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba med pa dang 'gal par bstan pas so //
analyzed: 'dis ni zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba med pa dang 'gal par bstan pas so //
translated: “By this” means by teaching the absence of concomitance and the contradiction.

original: ci ltar 'di bsal ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar 'di bsal ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is this refuted?

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Because,” etc.

original: grub pa la bsgrub par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: grub pa la bsgrub par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is established by the proof of the pervasion.

original: yul nges pa ma yin pa ni khyab pa sgrub pa'i tshad kyis grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul nges pa ma yin pa ni khyab pa sgrub pa'i tshad kyis grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The object is not ascertained, because it is established by the proof of the pervasion.🔽Even though the non-establishment of sound as impermanent is not the proof of impermanence, still it is a universal.🔽This is clarified.🔽Even though the non-establishment of sound as impermanent is not the proof of impermanence, still it is a universal.🔽This is clarified.🔽Even though the non-establishment of sound as impermanent is not the proof of impermanence, still it is a universal.🔽This is clarified.

original: gal te sgra la zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa nyid sgrub pa ma yin pa de lta na yang de spyi yin no zhes 'gal ba yin no//
analyzed: gal te sgra la zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa nyid sgrub pa ma yin pa de lta na yang de spyi yin no zhes 'gal ba yin no//
translated: Even though the non-establishment of sound as impermanent is not the proof of impermanence, still it is a universal.

original: @45a * // 'di nyid gsal 'debs pa ni /
analyzed: @45a * // 'di nyid gsal 'debs pa ni /
translated: This is clarified.🔽Even though the non-establishment of sound as impermanent is not the proof of impermanence, still it is a universal.🔽This is clarified.🔽Even though the non-establishment of sound as impermanent is not the proof of impermanence, still it is a universal.🔽This is clarified.🔽Even though the non-establishment of sound as impermanent is not the proof of impermanence, still it is a universal.🔽This is clarified.🔽Even though the non-establishment of sound as impermanent is not the proof of impermanence, still it is a universal.🔽This is clarified.🔽Even though the non-establishment of sound as impermanent is not the proof of impermanence, still it is a universal.

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is clarified.

original: the tsam gyis spyi de la khyad par gyi mthar thug pa'i da ni /
analyzed: the tsam gyis spyi de la khyad par gyi mthar thug pa'i da ni /
translated: Even though the non-establishment of sound as impermanent is not the proof of impermanence, still it is a universal.🔽This is clarified.🔽Even though the non-establishment of sound as impermanent is not the proof of impermanence, still it is a universal.🔽This is clarified.🔽Even though the non-establishment of sound as impermanent is not the proof of impermanence, still it is a universal.

original: phyogs kyi chos dang ldan pa las 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos dang ldan pa las 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: This is clarified.

original: 'brel ba bzung ba las gzhan zhes bya ba ni bya bar dran pa'i rjes thogs su 'gyur ba yin no //🔽chos can gyi khyad par nyin ni phyogs kyi chos kyi shugs kyis 'gyur ba yin gyi /
analyzed: 'brel ba bzung ba las gzhan zhes bya ba ni bya bar dran pa'i rjes thogs su 'gyur ba yin no // chos can gyi khyad par nyin ni phyogs kyi chos kyi shugs kyis 'gyur ba yin gyi /
translated: Even though the non-establishment of sound as impermanent is not the proof of impermanence, still it is a universal.🔽This is clarified.🔽Even though the non-establishment of sound as impermanent is not the proof of impermanence, still it is a universal.🔽This is clarified.🔽Even though the non-establishment of sound as impermanent is not the proof of impermanence, still it is a universal.

original: 'brel ba dran pa'i dbang gis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'brel ba dran pa'i dbang gis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is clarified.🔽Even

original: gal te gang gis dpe la rjes su 'gro bar mthong ba de 'di na med pa'i phyir ci ltar de'i khyad par can du 'grub snyam na /
analyzed: gal te gang gis dpe la rjes su 'gro bar mthong ba de 'di na med pa'i phyir ci ltar de'i khyad par can du 'grub snyam na /
translated: If one thinks that because it is seen to follow the example, it is not here, how can it be established as its qualifier?

original: de nyid do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid do zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is just that.

original: 'di ni gcig nyid kyi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gcig nyid kyi rnam pa'o //
translated: This is the form of identity.

original: khyad par dang 'brel pa rtogs pa la nyes pa ci yod snyam na /
analyzed: khyad par dang 'brel pa rtogs pa la nyes pa ci yod snyam na /
translated: If one thinks what is the fault in the cognition of the connection with the qualifier?

original: yul dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yul dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The object, etc.

original: gal te yul la sogs par nges pa'i chu skom zhi bar byed pa ga dang ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te yul la sogs par nges pa'i chu skom zhi bar byed pa ga dang ba yin no //
translated: If the water that is ascertained as the object, etc. is the quencher of thirst, it is pure.

original: de'i don du nye par gzhan du 'jug bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir na /
analyzed: de'i don du nye par gzhan du 'jug bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir na /
translated: For the sake of that, it will not engage elsewhere.

original: khyad par dang 'brel pa rtogs na tha snyad med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyad par dang 'brel pa rtogs na tha snyad med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if the connection with the qualifier is cognized, there will be no convention.

original: des na khyab pa ni spyi nyid la nges pa yin no //
analyzed: des na khyab pa ni spyi nyid la nges pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the pervasion is ascertained in the universal itself.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: If, etc. is the opponent's.

original: spyi ni sgrub par byed pa'i spyi'o //
analyzed: spyi ni sgrub par byed pa'i spyi'o //
translated: The universal is the proving universal.

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang lhan cig spyi rtogs pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang lhan cig spyi rtogs pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: If the cognition of the universal is only together with the probandum,🔽then, etc.

original: bsgrub par bya ba yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: and the probandum is the probanci.

original: bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The idea is this:

original: ci srid bsgrub par bya ba dang lhan cig sgrub par byed pa ma rtogs pa de srid du ni rjes su dpag pa med la /
analyzed: ci srid bsgrub par bya ba dang lhan cig sgrub par byed pa ma rtogs pa de srid du ni rjes su dpag pa med la /
translated: As long as the probans is not understood to be concomitant with the probandum, there is no inference.

original: ci srid rjes su dpag pa med pa de srid du yang bsgrub bya dang lhan cig sgrub byed mi rtogs te des na nang gi khyab pa ni mi 'thad pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci srid rjes su dpag pa med pa de srid du yang bsgrub bya dang lhan cig sgrub byed mi rtogs te des na nang gi khyab pa ni mi 'thad pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: And as long as there is no inference, the probans is not understood to be concomitant with the probandum. Therefore, internal pervasion is not tenable.

original: de lta na'o na phyi'i khyab bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na'o na phyi'i khyab bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then there is external pervasion.

original: phyi'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyi'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: External pervasion is not established.

original: ci'i phyir 'grub pa ma yin zhe na /🔽phyogs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'grub pa ma yin zhe na / phyogs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Why is it not established?🔽The subject is not established.

original: phyogs ma yin pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: phyogs ma yin pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: The non-subject, etc.

original: bstan par mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: bstan par mi bya ba'o //
translated: is not to be taught.

original: khyab ba'i rnam pa brjod pa'o //
analyzed: khyab ba'i rnam pa brjod pa'o //
translated: The form of pervasion is stated.

original: rnam ba 'di 'dra ba'i khyab pa la ni bsgrub bya 'grub pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam ba 'di 'dra ba'i khyab pa la ni bsgrub bya 'grub pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: In this kind of pervasion, the probandum is not established,

original: bsgrub par bya ba khyab par ma 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba khyab par ma 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the probandum is not included in the pervasion.

original: rtsod pa 'di nyid sdud pa ni /
analyzed: rtsod pa 'di nyid sdud pa ni /
translated: The summary of this argument is:

original: des na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, etc.

original: nang gi khyab pa mi 'grub pa ni phan tshun brten pa'i nyes pas so //
analyzed: nang gi khyab pa mi 'grub pa ni phan tshun brten pa'i nyes pas so //
translated: The non-establishment of the internal pervasion is due to the fault of mutual dependence.

original: des na phyi'i khyab pa la brten par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: des na phyi'i khyab pa la brten par bya ba yin na /
translated: Therefore, it should be based on the external pervasion.

original: phyi'i khyab pa de la ni nam yang bsgrub bya 'grub pa med do //
analyzed: phyi'i khyab pa de la ni nam yang bsgrub bya 'grub pa med do //
translated: But in that external pervasion, the probandum is never established.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gal te gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: If it is different, etc.

original: nang gi khyab pa dang phyi'i khyab pa'i tshul 'di ni gzhan la ltos nas @45b brjod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: nang gi khyab pa dang phyi'i khyab pa'i tshul 'di ni gzhan la ltos nas @45b brjod pa yin gyi /
translated: This method of internal and external pervasion is stated in relation to others,

original: rang gi sde ba la ltos nas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi sde ba la ltos nas ni ma yin no //
translated: but not in relation to our own schools.

original: gzhan dag ni grub pa la sgrub pa'i nyes ba spang pa'i don tu phyogs nang du ma bsdus par khyab par rtogs par byed cing ston par yang byed do //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni grub pa la sgrub pa'i nyes ba spang pa'i don tu phyogs nang du ma bsdus par khyab par rtogs par byed cing ston par yang byed do //
translated: Others, in order to avoid the fault of proving what is already established, realize and teach the pervasion without including the subject internally.

original: des na 'di ni phyi'i khyab pa smra pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na 'di ni phyi'i khyab pa smra pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, this is called the proponent of external pervasion.

original: yang gang zhig phyogs nang du bsdus nas khyab pa ston pa de ni nang gi khyab pa smra ba yin gyi /
analyzed: yang gang zhig phyogs nang du bsdus nas khyab pa ston pa de ni nang gi khyab pa smra ba yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, he who demonstrates the pervasion by subsuming the subject under the reason is a proponent of internal pervasion.

original: bram ze aar tsa ta lta bu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bram ze aar tsa ta lta bu ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not like the Brahmin Arcața.

original: chos can dang bcas pa'i khyab pa'i rnam pa brjod pa ni /
analyzed: chos can dang bcas pa'i khyab pa'i rnam pa brjod pa ni /
translated: The statement of the form of the pervasion along with the subject is

original: gang gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Whatever is whatever . . .” and so on.

original: 'dis ni phyogs nang du bsdus ba kho nas sgrub par byed pa la bsgrub byas khyab pa bsgrub par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dis ni phyogs nang du bsdus ba kho nas sgrub par byed pa la bsgrub byas khyab pa bsgrub par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: This demonstrates that the probandum pervades the proof only by subsuming it under the subject.

original: gang gis khyab pa ma grub par bsgrub pa rjes su dpag pa de nyid las bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang tshad ma gzhan las yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gis khyab pa ma grub par bsgrub pa rjes su dpag pa de nyid las bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang tshad ma gzhan las yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is not that the probandum is understood from the inference itself, which proves the pervasion that is not established, but rather it is from another valid knowledge.

original: gal te so sor nges pa'i yul na gnas pa'i me khyab pa'i dus su ci ltar bzung na yang rjes su dpag pa don med par 'gyur ro zhes dogs na /
analyzed: gal te so sor nges pa'i yul na gnas pa'i me khyab pa'i dus su ci ltar bzung na yang rjes su dpag pa don med par 'gyur ro zhes dogs na /
translated: If one wonders, “When the pervasion of fire by smoke is present in a particular place, then no matter how it is apprehended, the inference would be pointless,”

original: phyogs 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyogs 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: [the response is] “this place . . .”

original: phyogs 'di ni me dang ldan pa yin te du ba dang ldan pa'i phyir tshang bad ni phyogs bzhin no zhes bya bar rjes su dpag pas gzung bar ldan pa'i don ni /
analyzed: phyogs 'di ni me dang ldan pa yin te du ba dang ldan pa'i phyir tshang bad ni phyogs bzhin no zhes bya bar rjes su dpag pas gzung bar ldan pa'i don ni /
translated: This direction is endowed with fire, because it is endowed with smoke, like a kitchen.

original: sngar zhes bya ba khyab pa 'dzin pa'i dus nyi du gzung ngo zhes brjod bar zad kyi de kho nar ni gzung ba med do //
analyzed: sngar zhes bya ba khyab pa 'dzin pa'i dus nyi du gzung ngo zhes brjod bar zad kyi de kho nar ni gzung ba med do //
translated: The meaning of “endowed with” is understood at the time of the apprehension of the pervasion, as previously stated, but not at the time of the apprehension of the pakṣadharma.

original: de kho nar ma bzung na gzung zhes ci ltar brjod snyam na /🔽de lta bu nyid rtogs pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de kho nar ma bzung na gzung zhes ci ltar brjod snyam na / de lta bu nyid rtogs pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is not apprehended at that time, how can it be said to be apprehended?

original: khyab pa 'dzin pa'i dus su 'ol spyi'i rnam pa tsam du ldan pa'i don rtogs pa'i shugs kyis so //🔽de lta ma yin te zhes bya ba ni gal te 'dod pa tsam gyi shugs kyis mi brjod kyis 'on kyang yul la sogs par nges pa'i bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pa nyid du brjod na'o //
analyzed: khyab pa 'dzin pa'i dus su 'ol spyi'i rnam pa tsam du ldan pa'i don rtogs pa'i shugs kyis so // de lta ma yin te zhes bya ba ni gal te 'dod pa tsam gyi shugs kyis mi brjod kyis 'on kyang yul la sogs par nges pa'i bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pa nyid du brjod na'o //
translated: It is said that “the meaning of ‘endowed with’ is understood by the force of the understanding of the mere general form of the pervasion.”🔽If that were not so, if it were not expressed by the force of mere desire, but rather by the understanding of the probandum, such as the object, etc.,

original: 'di nyid brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is said: if it is not expressed by the force of mere desire, but rather by the understanding of the probandum, such as the object, etc.,

original: de'i tshe rjes su dpag bas ci bya /
analyzed: de'i tshe rjes su dpag bas ci bya /
translated: What use is there for inference at that time?

original: sngar gyi zhes bya ba tshang bang na gnas pa'i du ba rtogs pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: sngar gyi zhes bya ba tshang bang na gnas pa'i du ba rtogs pa nyid du'o //
translated: The word “previously” is supplied.

original: des na khyab pa 'dzin pa'i dus na /
analyzed: des na khyab pa 'dzin pa'i dus na /
translated: Therefore, when the pervasion is apprehended,

original: de kho nar bsgrub bya rtogs pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de kho nar bsgrub bya rtogs pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: the object to be established is not realized in reality.

original: de rtogs pa ni srid pa yang ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de rtogs pa ni srid pa yang ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: The statement “it is not possible to realize it”

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: is supplied by “it would arise.”

original: khyab pa 'dzin pa'i dus na med pa yin no //
analyzed: khyab pa 'dzin pa'i dus na med pa yin no //
translated: It does not exist at the time of apprehending the pervasion.

original: ci'i phyir gang gi phyir 'byung par 'gyur ba yin pas so //
analyzed: ci'i phyir gang gi phyir 'byung par 'gyur ba yin pas so //
translated: Why? Because it would arise.

original: de'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba khyab pa'i dus kyi 'ol spyir rtogs pa yod pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba khyab pa'i dus kyi 'ol spyir rtogs pa yod pa nyid kyis so //
translated: “Its nature” refers to the apprehension of the general characteristic at the time of the pervasion.

original: gzhan gyi tha snyad tsam gyi zhes smras so //🔽gal te khyab pa'i @46a * //
analyzed: gzhan gyi tha snyad tsam gyi zhes smras so // gal te khyab pa'i @46a * //
translated: “It is merely the convention of others” is supplied.

original: tshe lhag par zhen pas dngos po ma bzung na de'i tshe lhag par zhen pa de bsdu bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshe lhag par zhen pas dngos po ma bzung na de'i tshe lhag par zhen pa de bsdu bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If, at the time of the pervasion, the thing is not apprehended because of the adherence to the superimposition, then at that time the adherence to the superimposition would be included. This is the meaning.

original: lan ni de lta bu'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni de lta bu'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is “In that case . . . ”

original: gal te bya ba pa'i lhag par zhen pa sres byed ma yin pa la sogs par 'gyur ba yin na de'i tshe slu bar 'gyur ro gang gi tshe med dang du bdag la srog pa la sogs par byed pa dang mtshul du brku ba la sogs par byed
analyzed: gal te bya ba pa'i lhag par zhen pa sres byed ma yin pa la sogs par 'gyur ba yin na de'i tshe slu bar 'gyur ro gang gi tshe med dang du bdag la srog pa la sogs par byed pa dang mtshul du brku ba la sogs par byed
translated: If one were to engage in such actions with the thought that one is not deceiving others, then one would deceive them.🔽When one engages in killing and so on for the sake of one's own life and so on, and when one steals in order to avoid poverty,🔽

original: par lhag par zhen par byed pa de'i tshe ni slu ba ma yin no //
analyzed: par lhag par zhen par byed pa de'i tshe ni slu ba ma yin no //
translated: If one were to conceive of the object of action as something other than what it is, then it would be deceptive. But when one conceives of the object of action as something that is not existent, such as a life-force, and one conceives of the action as something that is not existent, such as stealing, then it is not deceptive.🔽What is the certainty here?

original: nges pa 'di zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'i don bya ba byed ga kho na la khyab par lhag par zhen gyi gzhan lam yin no zhes bya ba'i des pa 'di ci yod de 'ga' yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to ;
