analyzed: 'di la yang nyes pa sngar brjod zin pas yang mi brjod do //
translated: Here also, since the fault has already been stated, it will not be stated again.

original: der yang ni 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba la'o //
analyzed: der yang ni 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba la'o //
translated: And there, the non-mistaken contradiction is in relation to the non-mistaken contradiction.

original: 'dir yang byas pa la sogs par ro //
analyzed: 'dir yang byas pa la sogs par ro //
translated: And here, it is in relation to the produced, etc.

original: 'gal nges la te 'gal ba 'khrul pa can gyi gtan tshigs gnyis la gnod par 'gyur te phan tshul stobs mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal nges la te 'gal ba 'khrul pa can gyi gtan tshigs gnyis la gnod par 'gyur te phan tshul stobs mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the case of a definite contradiction, the two contradictory and non-mistaken reasons are invalidated, because they are mutually equal in strength.

original: 'gal ba'i don dag ni chos can gcig la bsgrub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gal ba'i don dag ni chos can gcig la bsgrub pa ma yin te /
translated: The meaning of contradiction is not established in one and the same subject,

original: mi ltung ba'i phyir ro //🔽byas pa nyid 'dir ni 'gal ba mi 'khrul bltar bstan bcos dang 'gal ba yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mi ltung ba'i phyir ro // byas pa nyid 'dir ni 'gal ba mi 'khrul bltar bstan bcos dang 'gal ba yod pa ma yin te /
translated: because it does not fall.

original: dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i rjes su dpag ba ni bstan bcos kyis gnod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i rjes su dpag ba ni bstan bcos kyis gnod pa ma yin no //
translated: Here, the fact of being produced is not contradicted by the treatise, as the inference based on the power of fact is not contradicted by the treatise.

original: lung ni de lta bu zhes bya ba dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: lung ni de lta bu zhes bya ba dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Scripture is not like that, that is, it does not proceed by the power of fact.

original: de dag ni ste bstan bcos dang rjes su dpag ba dag ni phan tshun gnod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni ste bstan bcos dang rjes su dpag ba dag ni phan tshun gnod pa ma yin te /
translated: Those two, that is, the treatise and inference, do not contradict each other,

original: rjes su dpag pa kho na gnod byed yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa kho na gnod byed yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because inference alone is the contradictor.

original: gal te 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba can dag gis 'gal ba gnyis bsgrub par ci ste mi 'gyur des na phan tshun gnod pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba can dag gis 'gal ba gnyis bsgrub par ci ste mi 'gyur des na phan tshun gnod pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If those with nonerroneous contradiction were to establish two contradictions, why would they not be mutually contradictory?🔽Therefore, they are not mutually contradictory.

original: gnyi ga zhes gsungs so//
analyzed: gnyi ga zhes gsungs so//
translated: If you say that, he says both.

original: tshad ma nyid ma yin pas gnod byed ma yin no zhes lhag ma'o //
analyzed: tshad ma nyid ma yin pas gnod byed ma yin no zhes lhag ma'o //
translated: The remainder is: because it is not a valid cognition, it is not a refutation.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni gnod par byed pa nyid ma yin pas na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni gnod par byed pa nyid ma yin pas na'o //
translated: Therefore means: because it is not a refutation.

original: de'i ste lung gi don rjes su dpag par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i ste lung gi don rjes su dpag par bya ba'o //
translated: Its means: the meaning of the scripture is to be inferred.

original: bstan bcos kyi don gnod par byed pa ni ma yin no //🔽gang gis de gnod byed ma yin pa ci ltar bstan bcos @52a * //
analyzed: bstan bcos kyi don gnod par byed pa ni ma yin no // gang gis de gnod byed ma yin pa ci ltar bstan bcos @52a * //
translated: The meaning of the treatise is not a refutation.

original: tshad ma ma yin zhe na tshad ma'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin zhe na tshad ma'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: By what is it not a refutation? How is the treatise not a valid cognition?  Valid cognition is stated.

original: ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bstan bcos dang rjes su dpag pa dag phan tshun gnod par ston pa'o //
analyzed: ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bstan bcos dang rjes su dpag pa dag phan tshun gnod par ston pa'o //
translated: If one says why? and so on, it shows that the treatise and inference mutually contradict each other.

original: de ci ltar rjes su dpag pas gnod ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ci ltar rjes su dpag pas gnod ces bya ba ni /
translated: How is it that inference contradicts it?

original: 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa ltar phan tshun gnod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa ltar phan tshun gnod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means that they would mutually contradict each other like a non-mistaken contradiction.

original: des ni bstan bcos kyis so //
analyzed: des ni bstan bcos kyis so //
translated: By that, the treatise.

original: 'dir yang ni rjes su dpag pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: 'dir yang ni rjes su dpag pa la yang ngo //
translated: Here also, inference.

original: gal te 'gal ba'i rjes su dpag pa la bstan bcos kyis gnod na de'i tshe tshad ma mtha' dag nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'gal ba'i rjes su dpag pa la bstan bcos kyis gnod na de'i tshe tshad ma mtha' dag nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the treatise is invalidated by a contradictory inference, then all valid cognitions would be undermined.

original: des na lung 'ba' zhig lus pa yin no //
analyzed: des na lung 'ba' zhig lus pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, only scripture would remain.

original: dogs pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dogs pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The doubt is expressed by “But if . . .”

original: de ni bstan bcos so //
analyzed: de ni bstan bcos so //
translated: That is the treatise.

original: lan ni tshad ma ma yin pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni tshad ma ma yin pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is “It is not a valid cognition . . .”

original: dogs pa ni rjes su dpag pas gnod pa'i bstan bcos tshad ma ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dogs pa ni rjes su dpag pas gnod pa'i bstan bcos tshad ma ma yin gyi /
translated: The doubt is that a treatise that is undermined by an inference is not a valid cognition,

original: thams cad ni ste mi gnod pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: thams cad ni ste mi gnod pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: but not all are undermined.

original: lan du bstan bcos kyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan du bstan bcos kyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is “The treatise . . . ”

original: brtags pa zhes bya ba ni brtags pa'i bstan bcos gang yin pa de rjes su dpag pa'i gnod phyed yin la /
analyzed: brtags pa zhes bya ba ni brtags pa'i bstan bcos gang yin pa de rjes su dpag pa'i gnod phyed yin la /
translated: “Investigated” means that a treatise that is investigated is undermined by inference.

original: ma brtags pa'i bstan bcos ni rjes su dpag pas tshur gnod pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma brtags pa'i bstan bcos ni rjes su dpag pas tshur gnod pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: A treatise that is not investigated is undermined by inference.

original: rjes su dpag pa nyid ces bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa nyid ces bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: “Inference itself” refers to a philosophical tenet.

original: ci'i phyir bstan bcos tshad ma'i rgyu ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bstan bcos tshad ma'i rgyu ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is a treatise not a cause of valid knowledge?

original: de la zhes bya ba'o //🔽rjes su dpag pa de la med pa'i tshad mas ni ;
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba'o // rjes su dpag pa de la med pa'i tshad mas ni ;
translated: “That” refers to the inference.

original: / lung de la yod pa'i tshad ma yod par byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: / lung de la yod pa'i tshad ma yod par byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The valid cognition that does not exist in that inference does not make the valid cognition that exists in the scripture exist.

original: des te rjes su dpag pas so //
analyzed: des te rjes su dpag pas so //
translated: “By that” means by the inference.

original: rjes su dpag pa de'i gnyen po lung ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa de'i gnyen po lung ma yin no //
translated: The scripture is not the antidote to that inference.

original: 'dir yang ni bstan bcos dang rjes su dpag ba dag la'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang ni bstan bcos dang rjes su dpag ba dag la'o //
translated: Here, the treatise and the inference are the two.

original: byas pa la sogs pa'i sgrub par byed pa skyon dang ldan pa ni ma yin pa'o//
analyzed: byas pa la sogs pa'i sgrub par byed pa skyon dang ldan pa ni ma yin pa'o//
translated: The probative argument, such as “because it is produced,” is not faulty.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni nam mkha'i yon tan ma yin pa dang mi rtag pa dag go //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni nam mkha'i yon tan ma yin pa dang mi rtag pa dag go //
translated: “Those” refers to the non-quality of space and impermanence.

original: 'brel pa med kyang zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i yon tan dang mi rtag pa nyid la med na mi 'byung ba med kyang ngo //
analyzed: 'brel pa med kyang zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i yon tan dang mi rtag pa nyid la med na mi 'byung ba med kyang ngo //
translated: “Even though there is no relation” means even though there is no invariable relation between the non-quality of space and impermanence.

original: bstan bcos kyi don ni nam mkha'i yon tan te des bslad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bstan bcos kyi don ni nam mkha'i yon tan te des bslad pa'i phyir /
translated: The meaning of the treatise is the quality of space, because it is contaminated by that.

original: gal te byas pa nyid gnod na de'i tshe sgrub par byed pa thams cad thams cad kyi gnod byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te byas pa nyid gnod na de'i tshe sgrub par byed pa thams cad thams cad kyi gnod byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: If production itself is faulty, then all probative arguments would be faulty for everyone.

original: grub pa'i mtha'i tshad ma rnam par 'grel pa ni skabs kyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha'i tshad ma rnam par 'grel pa ni skabs kyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The commentary on the measure of the philosophical position is the word “here.”

original: byas pa de de nyid dam gzhan rtsol ba las byung ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: byas pa de de nyid dam gzhan rtsol ba las byung ba la sogs pas so //
translated: That which is produced is either that itself or something else, by effort, etc.

original: nam mkha'i yon tan nyid chos can de dang 'brel pa'i chos can de nyid @52b la gnod pa'i phyir te chos can gzhan la ni ma yin pa'i phyir gnod pa yin no zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: nam mkha'i yon tan nyid chos can de dang 'brel pa'i chos can de nyid @52b la gnod pa'i phyir te chos can gzhan la ni ma yin pa'i phyir gnod pa yin no zhes 'brel to //
translated: The quality of space is the subject, and the subject related to that is harmed by that itself, not by another subject. This is the connection.

original: de ni nam mkha'i yon tan nyid do //
analyzed: de ni nam mkha'i yon tan nyid do //
translated: That is the quality of space.

original: byas pa de rang gis sgrub par byed pa mi rtag pa la mi mthun pa med kyang ngo //
analyzed: byas pa de rang gis sgrub par byed pa mi rtag pa la mi mthun pa med kyang ngo //
translated: That which is produced is not contradicted by its own establishment, impermanence.

original: de las gzhan 'brel pa med pa nam mkha'i yon tan nyid la gnod pas so //
analyzed: de las gzhan 'brel pa med pa nam mkha'i yon tan nyid la gnod pas so //
translated: But from that, there is no connection with something else, the quality of space, because it is harmed.

original: bdag med pa ltar med na bsgrub par bya ba mi rtag pa nyid mi 'byung pa'i 'brel ba de ni nam mkha'i yon tan nyid 'dir rtog pa med do //
analyzed: bdag med pa ltar med na bsgrub par bya ba mi rtag pa nyid mi 'byung pa'i 'brel ba de ni nam mkha'i yon tan nyid 'dir rtog pa med do //
translated: Like selflessness, if impermanence, the probandum, does not occur, there is no connection. That is not imagined here in the quality of space.

original: bstan bcos la gnod pa de chos can gzhan la gtan tshigs gzhan gyis bstan bcos gnod par byas pa la yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: bstan bcos la gnod pa de chos can gzhan la gtan tshigs gzhan gyis bstan bcos gnod par byas pa la yang mtshungs so //
translated: The fault of the treatise is the same in the case of another subject, by another reason, when the treatise is refuted.

original: bsgrub par bya ba mi rtag pa nyid kyi khyad pa byed pa bdag med pa gang yin pa de med par sgrub pa ni spang par bya ba yin gyis /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba mi rtag pa nyid kyi khyad pa byed pa bdag med pa gang yin pa de med par sgrub pa ni spang par bya ba yin gyis /
translated: The absence of the self, which is the differentia of the probandum impermanence, is what is to be refuted.

original: khyab par byed pa ma yin pa nam mkha'i yon tan nyid med par sgrub pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa ma yin pa nam mkha'i yon tan nyid med par sgrub pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But the absence of the quality of space, which is not the differentia, is not to be refuted.

original: ci'i phyir 'di spang bar bya snyam na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di spang bar bya snyam na /
translated: Why is this to be refuted?

original: bsgrub par bya ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The probandum is what is to be established.

original: gang yin pa de la zhes bya ba bdag med pa la'o //
analyzed: gang yin pa de la zhes bya ba bdag med pa la'o //
translated: That is, the absence of the self.

original: de med na ni bdag med pa med na khyab par bya ba mi rtag pa nyid kyang ldog pa'i phyir ro //🔽'o na nam mkha'i yon tan nyid la sogs pa yang spang bar bya ba yin no snyam na /
analyzed: de med na ni bdag med pa med na khyab par bya ba mi rtag pa nyid kyang ldog pa'i phyir ro // 'o na nam mkha'i yon tan nyid la sogs pa yang spang bar bya ba yin no snyam na /
translated: If that is absent, if the absence of the self is absent, then the pervaded, impermanence, is also negated.🔽Well, then, the quality of space, etc., are also to be refuted.

original: nam mkha'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The quality of space, etc.

original: de med kyang ni nam mkha'i yon tan med kyang ngo //
analyzed: de med kyang ni nam mkha'i yon tan med kyang ngo //
translated: Even though it does not exist, the quality of space does not exist.

original: gzhan bye brag pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni tshad ma kun las btus pa'i bshad pa byed par ni ma zad pa'o //🔽rigs pa can la sogs pa de ltar na yang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan bye brag pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni tshad ma kun las btus pa'i bshad pa byed par ni ma zad pa'o // rigs pa can la sogs pa de ltar na yang ngo //
translated: Others, such as the Vaiśeṣikas, do not accept that the thesis is the meaning of the treatise.

original: bstan pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni 'di na me yod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //🔽bstan bcos kyi don bstan pa ni dam bca' bar 'gyur pa nyid do //
analyzed: bstan pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni 'di na me yod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // bstan bcos kyi don bstan pa ni dam bca' bar 'gyur pa nyid do //
translated: Even though the Naiyāyikas and others do not accept that the thesis is the meaning of the treatise, they do accept that the thesis is the meaning of the scripture. To show this, it says, Even though it is not taught in the treatise.🔽The meaning of the treatise is the thesis.

original: bstan bcos su bstan pa'i don ni dam bca' ba yin la /
analyzed: bstan bcos su bstan pa'i don ni dam bca' ba yin la /
translated: The meaning taught in the treatise is the thesis.

original: ma bstan pa'i don ni dam bca' ba ma yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: ma bstan pa'i don ni dam bca' ba ma yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: The meaning not taught in the treatise is not the thesis.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: To show this, it says, In this way.

original: gang dang gang lung yin pa de ni dam bca' ba yin no //
analyzed: gang dang gang lung yin pa de ni dam bca' ba yin no //
translated: Whatever is scripture is the thesis.

original: des na ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs la sogs pa yang lung la ltos pa nyid du thal ba'i phyir ma grub pa nyid la sogs pa'i nyes par mi 'gyur ro zhes de ma thag tu ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs la sogs pa yang lung la ltos pa nyid du thal ba'i phyir ma grub pa nyid la sogs pa'i nyes par mi 'gyur ro zhes de ma thag tu ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it follows that even the nonestablished reason, etc., depend on scripture, and so the fault of nonestablishment, etc., does not arise.

original: gzhan gyis gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The opponent says, “If, etc.”

original: 'dis ni lung gi don yang yin la dam bca' ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni lung gi don yang yin la dam bca' ba yang ma yin te /
translated: This shows that the meaning of scripture is not a thesis,

original: des na ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs la sogs pa brjod pa ni dam bca' bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin @53a * //
analyzed: des na ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs la sogs pa brjod pa ni dam bca' bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin @53a * //
translated: and so the statement of a nonestablished reason, etc., is not a thesis.

original: no ; / lan ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: no ; / lan ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is “No, because, etc.”

original: rang gi ngo bos ni dam bca' ba lung ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos ni dam bca' ba lung ma yin te /
translated: A thesis is not scripture by virtue of its own nature,

original: 'di na me yod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang lung du thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di na me yod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang lung du thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it follows that “There is fire here,” etc., would be scripture.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar rang gi ngo bos dam bca' ba lung ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar rang gi ngo bos dam bca' ba lung ma yin gyi /
translated: Because a thesis is not scripture by virtue of its own nature,

original: 'on kyang dam bca' ba'i don ston pa las yin pa des na'o//
analyzed: 'on kyang dam bca' ba'i don ston pa las yin pa des na'o//
translated: but rather it is from the statement of the meaning of the thesis.

original: de yang zhes bya ba gtan tshigs ma grub pa la sogs pa yang ngo //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba gtan tshigs ma grub pa la sogs pa yang ngo //
translated: Moreover, the reason is not established.

original: bstan bcos kyi don mtha' dag ces bya ba nas dam bca' ba ma yin no zhe na zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa ni rtsod ba'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos kyi don mtha' dag ces bya ba nas dam bca' ba ma yin no zhe na zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa ni rtsod ba'o //
translated: The entire content of the treatise, up to the conclusion that it is not a thesis, is the debate.

original: de lta na yang zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos kyi don mtha' dag bsgrub bya yin yang ngo //
analyzed: de lta na yang zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos kyi don mtha' dag bsgrub bya yin yang ngo //
translated: Even though, the entire content of the treatise is to be established,

original: bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa ma yin pa dam bca' ba ma yin pa nyid ga las she na /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa ma yin pa dam bca' ba ma yin pa nyid ga las she na /
translated: why is it not a thesis, which is not accepted as something to be established?

original: rab tu byed pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu byed pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The treatise is called a “chapter.”

original: gzhan dag rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas kyang sgrub par byed par bstan pa dam bca' ba ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan dag rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas kyang sgrub par byed par bstan pa dam bca' ba ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: Others, in another way, have taught that a proof is not a thesis.

original: tshad ma kun las btus pa las kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshad ma kun las btus pa las kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The Compendium of Logic also says.

original: rang gi ngo bo kho nar zhes nges par gzung ba'i phyir sgrub par byed par bstan pa ni dam bca' ba ma yin no zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo kho nar zhes nges par gzung ba'i phyir sgrub par byed par bstan pa ni dam bca' ba ma yin no zhes 'brel to //
translated: Since the statement of the proof is specified as being “only in terms of its own nature,” it is connected to the statement that it is not a thesis.

original: gal te sgrub byed nyid brjod pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te sgrub byed nyid brjod pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it is argued that the proof itself is stated,

original: ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs dang dpe sgrub byed nyid du brjod pa dag ni dam bca' ba ma yin te /
analyzed: ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs dang dpe sgrub byed nyid du brjod pa dag ni dam bca' ba ma yin te /
translated: the unestablished reason and example are stated as the proof, but they are not the thesis.

original: 'dod pa smos phyir na zhes bya ba bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa ni phyogs yin no zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod pa smos phyir na zhes bya ba bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa ni phyogs yin no zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it is stated as the desired object, the object of desire is the position.

original: 'di ni de ltar mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'di ni de ltar mi 'thad do //
translated: This is not tenable in that way.

original: ni zhes bya ba ni gang phyir te /
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba ni gang phyir te /
translated: Because means for what reason.

original: bsgrub par bya ba rigs pas thob pa ni bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa'i phyogs yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig las ldog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba rigs pas thob pa ni bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa'i phyogs yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig las ldog pa ma yin no //
translated: The object of proof obtained by reasoning is not the opposite of the statement The position is the object of desire that is the probandum.

original: des ci te mi ldog snyam na rigs pa ston pa'i zhes bya ste bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa phyogs yin no zhes bya ba ni rigs pa ston pa yin no //
analyzed: des ci te mi ldog snyam na rigs pa ston pa'i zhes bya ste bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa phyogs yin no zhes bya ba ni rigs pa ston pa yin no //
translated: If it is asked what is not reversed by that, it is the teaching of reasoning. The statement The position is the object of desire that is the probandum is the teaching of reasoning.

original: rigs pa nyid ni bstan bcos khas blangs phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rigs pa nyid ni bstan bcos khas blangs phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The very reasoning is because it is accepted in the treatise.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa phyogs yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gis bstan pa rigs pa yang sgrub par byed pa nyid du gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa phyogs yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gis bstan pa rigs pa yang sgrub par byed pa nyid du gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: The word or indicates that the position is what is to be established. The word reason indicates that the reason is what establishes. Why is that?

original: sgrub par byed pa nyid du bstan pa bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa nyid du bstan pa bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: The reason is not what is to be established.

original: 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It would be contradictory and non-erroneous, he says.

original: bstan bcos khas blangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni sgrub par byed pa gcig go //
analyzed: bstan bcos khas blangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni sgrub par byed pa gcig go //
translated: The statement because of accepting the treatise is one reason.

original: 'dod ba la 'gal ba brjod pa ni gzhan yin pas /
analyzed: 'dod ba la 'gal ba brjod pa ni gzhan yin pas /
translated: The statement of the contradiction in the thesis is another.

original: 'di gnyis 'gal ba @53b mi 'khrul ba can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di gnyis 'gal ba @53b mi 'khrul ba can du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, these two are contradictory and non-erroneous.

original: de lta na yin dang zhes bya ba the tshom skyed par byed pa yin dang / bstan bcos khas blangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs gang yin pa de sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yin dang zhes bya ba the tshom skyed par byed pa yin dang / bstan bcos khas blangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs gang yin pa de sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: If so, he says, it would generate doubt, and the reason 'because of accepting the treatise' is not a proof.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos las mthong ba sgrub par byed pa nyid du 'dod pa yin yang /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos las mthong ba sgrub par byed pa nyid du 'dod pa yin yang /
translated: Therefore, though the treatise Attainment of Knowledge asserts that seeing is the establishment of the object, it does not assert that seeing is the establishment of the object by the eye sense faculty.

original: bsgrub par bya ba nyid yin par ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba nyid yin par ga la 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, although the treatise wishes to establish that sound is impermanent, how could it be established?

original: mi 'gyur pa kho na ste 'dod pa'i tshig la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'gyur pa kho na ste 'dod pa'i tshig la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It could not be established, because the words “wished for” and so on are not a proof.

original: de lta na zhes bya ba rigs pa ma yin pa na'o //
analyzed: de lta na zhes bya ba rigs pa ma yin pa na'o //
translated: “ In that case” means “if it is not reasonable.”

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i yon tan nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i yon tan nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: “ Moreover” means “the quality of space and so on.”

original: de dang ldan ba'i phyir zhes bya ba nam mkha'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang ldan ba'i phyir zhes bya ba nam mkha'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “ Because it possesses that” means “because it possesses the quality of space.”

original: skyes pa'i gnas las gzhan du rna ba'i yul du yang ngo //
analyzed: skyes pa'i gnas las gzhan du rna ba'i yul du yang ngo //
translated: “ Also as an object of the ear” means “in a place other than the place of its origin.”

original: de nyid du zhes bya ba ni skyes pa'i gnas nyid du'o //
analyzed: de nyid du zhes bya ba ni skyes pa'i gnas nyid du'o //
translated: “ In that very place” means “in the place of its origin.”

original: gzhan gyi thag ring na 'dug pa zhes smras so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi thag ring na 'dug pa zhes smras so //
translated: “ It is far away from another” means “it is far away from another person.”

original: lan ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is “In that case.”

original: gzugs kyang rgyang ring ba dang mi ring ba dag gis mthong te des na de yang nam mkha'i yon tan nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs kyang rgyang ring ba dang mi ring ba dag gis mthong te des na de yang nam mkha'i yon tan nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Form is also seen as distant and not distant. Therefore, that is also a quality of space.

original: de'i ni nam mkha'i yon tan no //
analyzed: de'i ni nam mkha'i yon tan no //
translated: That is a quality of space.

original: de ltar ni thos pa yang ma yin te de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar ni thos pa yang ma yin te de'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not heard in that way.

original: gang las kyang ni tshad ma las so //
analyzed: gang las kyang ni tshad ma las so //
translated: From anywhere, from a valid means of knowledge.

original: gtan tshigs 'di nyid las zhes bya ba ni rten pa ma yin pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba las so //
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'di nyid las zhes bya ba ni rten pa ma yin pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba las so //
translated: This very reason is stated: because non-dependence is not tenable.

original: gzhan gyis smras pa sa la sogs pa ni nam mkha' la brten pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyis smras pa sa la sogs pa ni nam mkha' la brten pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Another says: Earth, etc. are not dependent on space.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: yon tan ma yin pa'i phyir te rdzas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan ma yin pa'i phyir te rdzas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not qualities, because they are substances.

original: lan ni brten ba nyid yin na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: lan ni brten ba nyid yin na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The answer is: If there were dependence...

original: gtan tshigs de nyid las brten ba nyid yin par grub pa ni /
analyzed: gtan tshigs de nyid las brten ba nyid yin par grub pa ni /
translated: From that very reason, dependence is established.

original: yon tan ma yin pa de nyid mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: yon tan ma yin pa de nyid mi 'grub bo //
translated: That very non-quality is not established.

original: nam mkha' rten yin na zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: nam mkha' rten yin na zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: If space were the support... is the answer.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni yon tan gyi rten nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni yon tan gyi rten nyid do //
translated: “That itself” is the support of the qualities.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is “form, etc.”

original: dogs pa bsu ba ni sal sogs pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dogs pa bsu ba ni sal sogs pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Anticipating an objection, he says, “etc.”

original: nam mkha' la mi 'du gsal bar byed pa ni /🔽gzugs la sogs gsal bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: nam mkha' la mi 'du gsal bar byed pa ni / gzugs la sogs gsal bar byed pa ni /
translated: The clarification of the non-inclusion of space is:🔽“The clarification of form, etc.”

original: gzugs la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Form, etc.”

original: 'phrod pa 'du pa zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: 'phrod pa 'du pa zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: The reply is “the contact.”

original: de dang zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' dang ngo //
analyzed: de dang zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' dang ngo //
translated: “That” is space.

original: dri yang sa dang lhan cig gcig tu dbyer med par ma rtogs pa'i phyir sa'i yon tan ma yin par 'gyur ro /
analyzed: dri yang sa dang lhan cig gcig tu dbyer med par ma rtogs pa'i phyir sa'i yon tan ma yin par 'gyur ro /
translated: Smell would not be an attribute of earth, because it is not perceived as inseparable from earth.

original: sgra de'i gnas de rten yang nam mkha' de nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: sgra de'i gnas de rten yang nam mkha' de nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: Space is the locus of sound, its support.

original: lan 'o na zhes @54a * //
analyzed: lan 'o na zhes @54a * //
translated: The reply is “Well then.”

original: bya ba'o // ci'i phyir nam mkha'i yon tan ma yin snyam na /
analyzed: bya ba'o // ci'i phyir nam mkha'i yon tan ma yin snyam na /
translated: Why is it not an attribute of space?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Because” is the reason.

original: gzhan nam mkha' rtag bas so //
analyzed: gzhan nam mkha' rtag bas so //
translated: It is different from space, which is permanent.

original: gang gis gang zhig 'dzin pa de'i yon tan de yin no zhes bya ba'i rigs pa thams cad du rung ba ma yin no zhes ston pa ci ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gis gang zhig 'dzin pa de'i yon tan de yin no zhes bya ba'i rigs pa thams cad du rung ba ma yin no zhes ston pa ci ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is not a proper argument, that the quality of the apprehender is the quality of the apprehended.

original: de bzhin du sgra yang nam mkhas bzung yang nam mkha'i yon tan ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra yang nam mkhas bzung yang nam mkha'i yon tan ma yin no //
translated: Sound is not a quality of space, even though space is the apprehender of sound.

original: 'di ga las snyam na /🔽sgra yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ga las snyam na / sgra yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Why is that?🔽Sound is not a quality of space.

original: yon tan dang zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i yon tan sgra dang ngo //
analyzed: yon tan dang zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i yon tan sgra dang ngo //
translated: The phrase “and so on” includes sound, which is a quality of space.

original: ldan pa med pa ni rlung ngo zhes bya ba ni ldan pa med pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldan pa med pa ni rlung ngo zhes bya ba ni ldan pa med pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “because of the absence of conjunction” means because of the absence of conjunction with wind.

original: sa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sa'i rdzas yin pa'i phyir shing pa la dang sa rlung ldan pa mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: sa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sa'i rdzas yin pa'i phyir shing pa la dang sa rlung ldan pa mi 'gal lo //
translated: The phrase “because of the nature of earth” means because of the nature of the earth element. Therefore, there is no contradiction in the conjunction of the wind and the earth element in a tree.🔽If that were not so,

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te rdzas ma yin pa yang rlung gis khyer na'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te rdzas ma yin pa yang rlung gis khyer na'o //
translated: that is, if wind did not carry what is not an earth element,

original: de ni grib ma la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni grib ma la sogs pa'o //
translated: such as a shadow,

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni shing la me tog sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni shing la me tog sogs pa'o //
translated: then a tree would not be able to bear a flower, and so on.

original: shing dang 'dus pa ni grib ma yin la /
analyzed: shing dang 'dus pa ni grib ma yin la /
translated: The shadow is the conjunction of the tree and the light.

original: rlung dang ni 'od kyi rdzas ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: rlung dang ni 'od kyi rdzas ldan pa yin no //
translated: The wind is the substance of the light.

original: des na 'byer pa 'dus pa'i rlung gis grib ma 'ded pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des na 'byer pa 'dus pa'i rlung gis grib ma 'ded pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the shadow is carried by the wind which is the conjunction of the dispersion.

original: rtog pa 'di'ang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtog pa 'di'ang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the theory.

original: gal te rlung dang nam mkha'ang du ldan pa de lta na yang nam mkha' ni rlung gis 'ded pa ma yin te bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te rlung dang nam mkha'ang du ldan pa de lta na yang nam mkha' ni rlung gis 'ded pa ma yin te bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even if the wind and space are in conjunction, space is not carried by the wind, because it is devoid of action.

original: gal te 'byer bar 'dus bas grib ma dang nyi ma la sogs pa khyer bar 'dod na de'i tshe rlung dang 'du ba'i 'brel bas 'dus pa'i sgra ded pa yin par cis mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te 'byer bar 'dus bas grib ma dang nyi ma la sogs pa khyer bar 'dod na de'i tshe rlung dang 'du ba'i 'brel bas 'dus pa'i sgra ded pa yin par cis mi 'gyur /
translated: If you maintain that the shadow and the light are carried by the conjunction of the dispersion, then why not say that the word conjunction is carried by the conjunction of the wind?

original: des na nam mkha' dang 'phrod pa 'du bar mi rtag go //
analyzed: des na nam mkha' dang 'phrod pa 'du bar mi rtag go //
translated: Therefore, the conjunction of space and the wind is not a conjunction.

original: de'i sgo nas ni rlung gi sgo nas so //
analyzed: de'i sgo nas ni rlung gi sgo nas so //
translated: By that means, by the wind.

original: de ni sgra'o //
analyzed: de ni sgra'o //
translated: That is the sound.

original: 'byor ba 'dus pa nyid kyis yon tan khyer ba ni ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'byor ba 'dus pa nyid kyis yon tan khyer ba ni ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: The word conjunction is not carried by the conjunction of the wind, because it is a quality.

original: yon tan yin yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yon tan yin yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Even though it is a quality, it is not carried by the conjunction of the wind.

original: der yang zhes bya ba ni dril yang ngo //
analyzed: der yang zhes bya ba ni dril yang ngo //
translated: “And” means “also.”

original: de dmigs kyang ni dri dmigs kyang ngo //
analyzed: de dmigs kyang ni dri dmigs kyang ngo //
translated: “And that” means “and the smell.”

original: de las ni sa la sogs pa las skyes pa'i dri'o //
analyzed: de las ni sa la sogs pa las skyes pa'i dri'o //
translated: “From that” means “from earth, etc.”

original: 'di'i ni yon tan smra ba'i'o //
analyzed: 'di'i ni yon tan smra ba'i'o //
translated: “This” means “the one who speaks of the qualities.”

original: 'on te yon tan bkag pa bzhin du bya ba dang bcas pa yang mi 'dod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te yon tan bkag pa bzhin du bya ba dang bcas pa yang mi 'dod do zhe na /
translated: But if you do not accept the existence of action even as it is refuted in the case of the qualities,

original: gal te bstan bcos la la'i yon tan nyid la sogs pa rigs pa yin pa bkag par bya ba dang bcas pa rigs pa yin yang yon tan 'di la mi 'dod pa 'di ni rgyal po'i chos lugs yin no //
analyzed: gal te bstan bcos la la'i yon tan nyid la sogs pa rigs pa yin pa bkag par bya ba dang bcas pa rigs pa yin yang yon tan 'di la mi 'dod pa 'di ni rgyal po'i chos lugs yin no //
translated: then this is the king’s law: “If the qualities, etc., are not reasonable, then the existence of action is not reasonable.”

original: 'di na bya ba dang bcas par khas blangs nas brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di na bya ba dang bcas par khas blangs nas brjod pa yin no //
translated: But we accept the existence of action and we speak of it.🔽But it does not exist anywhere.

original: de ni 'ga' la yang yod pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni 'ga' la yang yod pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “But” introduces another objection.

original: 'di ga las zhe na bya @54b ba dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ga las zhe na bya @54b ba dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “From what?” means “from the action.”

original: bya ba tsam mi srid pa'i phyir bya ba'i khyad par srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bya ba tsam mi srid pa'i phyir bya ba'i khyad par srid pa ma yin te /
translated: Since mere action is impossible, a particular action is impossible.

original: des na yul gzhan dang gzhan du skad cig 'dra ba gzhan skye ba nyid bya ba yin no zhes dgongs ba'o //
analyzed: des na yul gzhan dang gzhan du skad cig 'dra ba gzhan skye ba nyid bya ba yin no zhes dgongs ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the meaning is that it is the arising of another similar instant in another place that is the action.

original: 'on te 'di yang rdzas kho na la srid kyi yon tan dag la ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te 'di yang rdzas kho na la srid kyi yon tan dag la ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But this is possible only for substances, not for qualities.

original: de 'dra'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de 'dra'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word “such” refers to this.

original: sgra la te ltar ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /🔽gzhan dag ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: sgra la te ltar ci ltar 'gyur zhe na / gzhan dag ces bya ba'o //
translated: How is it for sound?🔽The word “others” refers to this.

original: 'di ni gzhan yang 'dod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ni gzhan yang 'dod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is what is meant by “others also assert this.”

original: rdzas med pa'i phyir yon tan yang med de /
analyzed: rdzas med pa'i phyir yon tan yang med de /
translated: Because there is no substance, there are no qualities.

original: des na ni 'byor par 'du bas ni 'dod pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: des na ni 'byor par 'du bas ni 'dod pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: Therefore, it is said that it is not asserted that they are combined because they are combined.

original: gzhan yang zhas bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhas bya ba'o //
translated: The word “also” refers to this.

original: yon tan can ni rdzas so //
analyzed: yon tan can ni rdzas so //
translated: The possessor of qualities is a substance.

original: 'byor bar 'dabs khyer bar khas blangs nas kyang nyes pa brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'byor bar 'dabs khyer bar khas blangs nas kyang nyes pa brjod pa ni /
translated: Even if one accepts that they are combined because they are related, the fault is stated.

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word “if” refers to this.

original: gzhan gyis smras pa ni gnas pa la zhes bya ba nas nam mkha'i yin no zhe na'i bar ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyis smras pa ni gnas pa la zhes bya ba nas nam mkha'i yin no zhe na'i bar ro //
translated: Another says that it is the state of rest, up to the state of space.

original: gal te gnas pa la gegs med pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: gal te gnas pa la gegs med pa'i phyir na /
translated: If it is said that endurance endures due to the absence of the cause of disintegration, then endurance would be endless.🔽

original: 'byung ba chen po nam mkha' gnas par rtog na /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po nam mkha' gnas par rtog na /
translated: If you imagine that space endures because there is no obstruction to its endurance,

original: de'i tshe 'di ma 'brel te /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'di ma 'brel te /
translated: then at that time this is not connected.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na phan tshun zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na phan tshun zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Why? It is said, “because of mutual dependence.”

original: de nyid sgrub pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //🔽des na med pa tsam nyid nam mkha' yin par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid sgrub pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o // des na med pa tsam nyid nam mkha' yin par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: The proof of that is stated: “If you imagine that space endures because there is no obstruction to its endurance, then at that time this is not connected.”🔽Therefore, it is said that mere nonexistence is space.

original: 'byung tshe gzhan med pa tsam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung tshe gzhan med pa tsam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said that “at the time of origination, mere nonexistence of the other elements is space.”

original: gzhi'i ngo bo nyid khas blangs nas kyang nyes pa brjod pa ni /
analyzed: gzhi'i ngo bo nyid khas blangs nas kyang nyes pa brjod pa ni /
translated: Even if you accept the intrinsic reality of the basis, a fault is stated:

original: ci ltar nam mkha' zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci ltar nam mkha' zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “How can space be the basis of wind?”

original: nam mkha' ni rlung gi yang gzhi ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni 'gro ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni rlung gi yang gzhi ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni 'gro ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said that “space is not the basis of wind.”

original: gegs byed pa dang ste lus can dang bral bas yin no //
analyzed: gegs byed pa dang ste lus can dang bral bas yin no //
translated: It is because it is devoid of physical objects that obstruct it.🔽It is said that “space is not the basis of wind because it is not a physical object.”

original: lus can ma yin pas byas pa yin gyi nam mkhas byas pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: lus can ma yin pas byas pa yin gyi nam mkhas byas pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: The meaning is that it is not created by space.

original: gzhan dag thug pa med pa'i nyes pa spong ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan dag thug pa med pa'i nyes pa spong ba ni /
translated: Others, in order to avoid the fault of infinite regress, say:

original: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Or else?

original: 'di la ni nam mkha' la'o //
analyzed: 'di la ni nam mkha' la'o //
translated: Here, in space.

original: lan ni gzugs med pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni gzugs med pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer: “The formless realm. ”

original: de nyid ni bdag go //
analyzed: de nyid ni bdag go //
translated: That itself is the self.

original: gzhan gyi ni sgra'i'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ni sgra'i'o //
translated: The other’s is sound.

original: 'on te gang zhig bdag mi 'dod pa de'i 'dod pa la ltos te nam mkha' ston pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gang zhig bdag mi 'dod pa de'i 'dod pa la ltos te nam mkha' ston pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if one does not accept the self, then the teaching of space is in dependence on the desire of others.

original: gang la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: To that, the verse:

original: de 'dra ba zhes bya ba na nam mkha' dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba zhes bya ba na nam mkha' dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: “That which is like that,

original: gang la dag gis don de byed pa ma yin pa de la nam mkhas kyang don de byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang la dag gis don de byed pa ma yin pa de la nam mkhas kyang don de byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: by which that object is not accomplished, by space also that object is not accomplished. ”

original: gang la bdag med pa des gdon mi za bar nam mkha' khas blang bar bya ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gang la bdag med pa des gdon mi za bar nam mkha' khas blang bar bya ba yang ma yin te /
translated: That which is without self, by that one should not accept space.

original: de ltar ma yin bar yang nam mkha'i bya ba 'grub pa'i @55a * //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin bar yang nam mkha'i bya ba 'grub pa'i @55a * //
translated: But if it is not so, then the activity of space is accomplished.

original: phyir zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: phyir zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: To that, the verse:

original: yul yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yul yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “The object also. ”

original: 'di nas khas blangs nas brjod par zad kyi /
analyzed: 'di nas khas blangs nas brjod par zad kyi /
translated: This is said after accepting it.

original: khyab pa'i dngos po ni srid pa yang ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: khyab pa'i dngos po ni srid pa yang ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: And it is not possible for a pervasive entity to exist.

original: phan tshun du ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phan tshun du ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is said in the phrase “mutually.

original: des na sgra nam mkha' la brten pa yin na /
analyzed: des na sgra nam mkha' la brten pa yin na /
translated: ” Therefore, if sound is based on space,

original: bdag la brten pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: bdag la brten pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: it would be based on the self.

original: pha rol po khyab pa rnams gcig nyid yin pa spang ba ni /
analyzed: pha rol po khyab pa rnams gcig nyid yin pa spang ba ni /
translated: The opponent’s assertion that pervasives are one is rejected in the following.

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase “if you say” refers to this.

original: grub ba'i mtha' pa yang gcig tu thal ba bor nas skabs su bab pa gzhan gyis brtags pa'i nam mkha' med par brjod pa ni /
analyzed: grub ba'i mtha' pa yang gcig tu thal ba bor nas skabs su bab pa gzhan gyis brtags pa'i nam mkha' med par brjod pa ni /
translated: The Sāṃkhya’s assertion that space is one is rejected in the following.

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase “if you say” refers to this.

original: 'on tha snyad du nam mkha' ci yin snyam na bug zhes bya ba'o//
analyzed: 'on tha snyad du nam mkha' ci yin snyam na bug zhes bya ba'o//
translated: But if you ask, “What is space conventionally?”🔽The answer is “an opening.”

original: ci ltar 'di la nam mkha' zhes tha snyad du byed snyam na /
analyzed: ci ltar 'di la nam mkha' zhes tha snyad du byed snyam na /
translated: How is it that space is designated conventionally?

original: bug med par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bug med par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is “where there is no obstruction.”

original: de'i phyir tha snyad kyi dbang gis nam mkha' gzhan med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir tha snyad kyi dbang gis nam mkha' gzhan med pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, space is nothing but a conceptual designation.

original: gal te bu gnam mkhar mi 'dod kyi 'on kyang gzhan yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te bu gnam mkhar mi 'dod kyi 'on kyang gzhan yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: If you say that an opening is not space but something else,

original: de la nyes pa 'dir 'gyur ba yin no zhes ston pa ni gang gi tshe zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la nyes pa 'dir 'gyur ba yin no zhes ston pa ni gang gi tshe zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement “This is the fault” is shown by the phrase “when there is no hole.”

original: bug med par zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bug med par zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The phrase “in the absence of a hole” means

original: mgo yor can gyi dngos po yod pa de'i tshe bu ga'i mtshan nyid kyi nam mkha' gar song /
analyzed: mgo yor can gyi dngos po yod pa de'i tshe bu ga'i mtshan nyid kyi nam mkha' gar song /
translated: that when there is an entity that is a head, where does the space go, which is characterized by a hole?

original: de med na yang zhes bya ba ni glo nas bud par dmigs pa med pa yang ngo //
analyzed: de med na yang zhes bya ba ni glo nas bud par dmigs pa med pa yang ngo //
translated: The phrase “in the absence of that” means that there is no perception of space coming out of the side.

original: de dang ni dngos bo'i gse ba na'o //
analyzed: de dang ni dngos bo'i gse ba na'o //
translated: It is in the entity that is the head.

original: gzhan na ni glo na'o //
analyzed: gzhan na ni glo na'o //
translated: It is in the side.

original: de nyid na zhes bya ba ni mgo yor can la'o //
analyzed: de nyid na zhes bya ba ni mgo yor can la'o //
translated: It is in the head.

original: 'gal lo zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' ni bug nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal lo zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' ni bug nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is a contradiction, because space is a hole.

original: gzhan gyi de na yang zhes bya ba ste bug med pa'i gnas na'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi de na yang zhes bya ba ste bug med pa'i gnas na'o //
translated: It is in the other, which is the place that is without a hole.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni de na nam mkha' med na'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni de na nam mkha' med na'o //
translated: Otherwise, if there were no space there,🔽that is, in the place that is without a hole,

original: de zhes bya ba ni bug med par byed pa'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni bug med par byed pa'i dngos po'o //
translated: the treatise commits an error.

original: grub pa'i mtha' bas rnam par brtags nas sel ba ni ci ste zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' bas rnam par brtags nas sel ba ni ci ste zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Having analyzed the philosophical position, the treatise commits an error. The phrase “why is that?”

original: gang las zhes bya ba ni ber gal sogs pa las /
analyzed: gang las zhes bya ba ni ber gal sogs pa las /
translated: “From which” means from a cause such as a clay pot.

original: de ni bum pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni bum pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “That” refers to a clay pot, etc.

original: bar gal sogs ba de med m'a bum pa la sogs pa de thogs pa nyid der 'gyur gyi'o //
analyzed: bar gal sogs ba de med m'a bum pa la sogs pa de thogs pa nyid der 'gyur gyi'o //
translated: If that clay pot, etc. did not exist, then the clay, etc. would be just as it was before.

original: de las gzhan dag tu zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi po med pa las gzhan nam mkha' la'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan dag tu zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi po med pa las gzhan nam mkha' la'o //
translated: “Other than that” means that which is other than the four great elements, i.e., space.

original: bsnyad pa tshad ma med do //
analyzed: bsnyad pa tshad ma med do //
translated: “No explanation” means no proof.

original: yang na bsnyad pa dang tshad ma yang med do zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang na bsnyad pa dang tshad ma yang med do zhes sbyar ro //
translated: Or else, “no explanation” means no proof.

original: 'o na yul la gnod pa med do snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na yul la gnod pa med do snyam na /
translated: If you think that the object is not impaired,

original: 'dis ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dis ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: then he says, “by this.”

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni shar la sogs pa'i rtogs pa'i yul yongs su gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni shar la sogs pa'i rtogs pa'i yul yongs su gzung ngo //
translated: The word “etc.” includes the objects of the concepts of east, etc.

original: gal te yul khyab pa ni nam mkha' bzhin du skabs 'byed @55b pa ma yin mod /
analyzed: gal te yul khyab pa ni nam mkha' bzhin du skabs 'byed @55b pa ma yin mod /
translated: If the object is not pervaded, like space, it is not an opening.

original: shar la sogs pa rtogs pa'i yul gyi ci ltar ma yin snyam na /
analyzed: shar la sogs pa rtogs pa'i yul gyi ci ltar ma yin snyam na /
translated: If you think that the objects of the concepts of east, etc. are not like that,

original: 'di ltar zhas bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhas bya ba'o //
translated: then he says, “in this way.”

original: yul khyab par khas len pa la nub la sogs pa rtogs bar mi 'gyur te tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul khyab par khas len pa la nub la sogs pa rtogs bar mi 'gyur te tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If one accepts that the object is all-pervading, then one would not cognize the west, etc., because there would be no difference.

original: bzhan  ba las te khyab pa ma yin pa las kyang nub la sogs pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur ba ma yin shing /
analyzed: bzhan  ba las te khyab pa ma yin pa las kyang nub la sogs pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur ba ma yin shing /
translated: And it is not the case that the convention of the west, etc., is from something other, i.e., from something that is not all-pervading.

original: yul de rnam pa gnyis lam gtog pa rnams yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yul de rnam pa gnyis lam gtog pa rnams yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And those objects are not of two natures.

original: de ni zhes bya ba nub pa la sogs pa med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba nub pa la sogs pa med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “ That” refers to the consequence that the west, etc., would not exist.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i skyes bu'i'o //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i skyes bu'i'o //
translated: “ Elsewhere” refers to the person who has gone to the other side.

original: gnyi ga'i rang bzhin ni shar nub kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i rang bzhin ni shar nub kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: “ Of both natures” refers to the nature of the east and the west.

original: de ltar gyur ba zhes bya ba ni nab la sogs par ro //
analyzed: de ltar gyur ba zhes bya ba ni nab la sogs par ro //
translated: “ In that way” refers to the west, etc.

original: 'di nyid gsal 'debs pa ni skyes bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid gsal 'debs pa ni skyes bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is clarified: “The person,” etc.

original: gzhan gyis gal te zhes smras so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis gal te zhes smras so //
translated: The other says: “If that is so,” etc.

original: des zhes bya ba ni yul gsal bar byed pas so //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni yul gsal bar byed pas so //
translated: “ That” refers to the object.

original: 'di ni phan tshun zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni phan tshun zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa'o //
translated: This is the mutual refutation.

original: de tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams nyid phan tshun ltos pa tsam gyis so //
analyzed: de tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams nyid phan tshun ltos pa tsam gyis so //
translated: “By that alone” means by the mere mutual dependence of things.

original: phan tshun brten pa'i nyes pa spod ba ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phan tshun brten pa'i nyes pa spod ba ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The fault of mutual dependence is stated in the phrase “if it were so.”

original: dper na drang po zhes bya ba'i tha snyad 'khyog po la ma ltos pa kho nar 'gyur ba yin na de lta na yang 'khyog po ni don gzhan kho na yin mong /
analyzed: dper na drang po zhes bya ba'i tha snyad 'khyog po la ma ltos pa kho nar 'gyur ba yin na de lta na yang 'khyog po ni don gzhan kho na yin mong /
translated: For example, the convention “straight” would be just that without depending on “crooked.” But even so, “crooked” would be just another object.

original: de bzhin du yul la ma ltos pa kho nar shar la sogs pa'i 'gyur ba yin yang /
analyzed: de bzhin du yul la ma ltos pa kho nar shar la sogs pa'i 'gyur ba yin yang /
translated: In the same way, the directions east, etc. would be just that without depending on objects.

original: yul don gzhan yang 'gyur ba kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yul don gzhan yang 'gyur ba kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that “object” would be just another object.

original: der yang ni drang bo la'o / drang ngo zhes rnam par rtog pa'i shes pas mthong ba ni ltos par bya ba'i khyad par 'khyog po las 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: der yang ni drang bo la'o / drang ngo zhes rnam par rtog pa'i shes pas mthong ba ni ltos par bya ba'i khyad par 'khyog po las 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: “In that case” means in the case of “straight.” The cognition that conceives of “straight” sees it as different from the object of dependence, “crooked.”

original: 'o na ci ltar 'khyog po la ma ltos pa kho nar 'di drang po zhig go zhes tha snyad byed pa yod snyam na nas zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar 'khyog po la ma ltos pa kho nar 'di drang po zhig go zhes tha snyad byed pa yod snyam na nas zhes smos so //
translated: But if you think that the convention “This is straight” exists without depending on “crooked,” the phrase “how could it be” is stated.

original: gzhan med par ni 'khyog po la sogs pa med par ni'o //
analyzed: gzhan med par ni 'khyog po la sogs pa med par ni'o //
translated: Without another, there is no crookedness, etc.

original: 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is clarified by “It is thus, etc.”

original: ltos par bya ba 'khyog po la sogs pa med kyang ro //
analyzed: ltos par bya ba 'khyog po la sogs pa med kyang ro //
translated: Even without the crookedness, etc., which are the bases of dependence,

original: de'i phyi phan tshun brten pa'i phyir shing zlog tu med pa kho na yin pa des na yul don gzhan brtag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyi phan tshun brten pa'i phyir shing zlog tu med pa kho na yin pa des na yul don gzhan brtag par mi bya'o //
translated: because of the mutual dependence of those two, the tree and the crookedness, etc. are not averted. Therefore, one should not imagine another object.

original: pha rol po dag 'di ga las shes 'dri ste dngos po nyid shar la sogs pa shes ba rgyu mtshan yin pa ga las grub ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: pha rol po dag 'di ga las shes 'dri ste dngos po nyid shar la sogs pa shes ba rgyu mtshan yin pa ga las grub ces bya ba'o //
translated: The opponent asks, “How do you know this?” That is, how is it established that the thing itself, such as the east, is the reason for the cognition?

original: lan ni gzhan du yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni gzhan du yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is “Even in another place.”

original: dngos po nyid yul gyi rnam par dbyes nges pa'i rgyu yin par ston pa @56a * //
analyzed: dngos po nyid yul gyi rnam par dbyes nges pa'i rgyu yin par ston pa @56a * //
translated: It shows that the thing itself is the cause of the determination of the division of the object.

original: ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “It is thus” shows that.

original: gal te de lta na yang rgyu skar la sogs pa'i sgo nas phyogs nyid des pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na yang rgyu skar la sogs pa'i sgo nas phyogs nyid des pa yin no snyam na /
translated: Even if that is so, one might think that the direction itself is determined by the stars, etc.

original: skar ma la sogs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skar ma la sogs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “The stars, etc.”

original: ci'i phyir phul mi rtog snyam na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir phul mi rtog snyam na /
translated: Why is it not considered to be the best?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is like this.

original: rgyu slar la sogs pa las kyang phyogs kyi rnam par dbye ba des pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: rgyu slar la sogs pa las kyang phyogs kyi rnam par dbye ba des pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: And also from the cause, etc.

original: de ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That is not so.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba shor nyid du snang yang /
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba shor nyid du snang yang /
translated: In another place, although it appears to be different,

original: nyi ma la sogs pas nye bar mtshon ba'i shar phyogs de nyid ni nyi ma'i dbang gis snang ba ni ma yin no zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: nyi ma la sogs pas nye bar mtshon ba'i shar phyogs de nyid ni nyi ma'i dbang gis snang ba ni ma yin no zhes 'brel to //
translated: that very eastern direction, which is illustrated by the sun, etc., is not illuminated by the sun.

original: gang la mi snang snyam na /🔽phyogs la rmongs pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang la mi snang snyam na / phyogs la rmongs pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Where is it not illuminated?🔽In the minds of those who are confused about directions.

original: phyogs la rmongs pa dang ldan pa'i yid ga la yod pa'i skyes bu rnams de la'o //
analyzed: phyogs la rmongs pa dang ldan pa'i yid ga la yod pa'i skyes bu rnams de la'o //
translated: In the minds of those who are confused about directions, those who are ignorant of the directions.

original: gsal 'debs pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gsal 'debs pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The illumination is like this.

original: grong dang kun dga' rab la sogs pa gang la ma 'khrul pa'i yid dang zhes bya ba ni nges pa de dang 'brel pa'i nyi ma 'char ba dang nub pa mthong bar gyur ba shin tu goms pa'i yul de nyid ma 'khrul bar nges par bya ba de🔽la shin tu goms pa yin no //
analyzed: grong dang kun dga' rab la sogs pa gang la ma 'khrul pa'i yid dang zhes bya ba ni nges pa de dang 'brel pa'i nyi ma 'char ba dang nub pa mthong bar gyur ba shin tu goms pa'i yul de nyid ma 'khrul bar nges par bya ba de la shin tu goms pa yin no //
translated: That is the place where one has become very familiar with the sun’s rising and setting.🔽What is the nature of that familiarity?

original: ci ltar gyur pa zhig snyam na kun dga' grong sogs zhes bya ba'o //🔽grong dang kun dga' rab la sogs pa /
analyzed: ci ltar gyur pa zhig snyam na kun dga' grong sogs zhes bya ba'o // grong dang kun dga' rab la sogs pa /
translated: The text says, “the village, the pleasure grove, and so on.”

original: rtag par rgyun du dmigs ba zhes 'brel to //🔽de la goms pa zhes bya ba nyid ma re la goms pa des nyams pa'i phyir te rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag par rgyun du dmigs ba zhes 'brel to // de la goms pa zhes bya ba nyid ma re la goms pa des nyams pa'i phyir te rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “always and continuously” is connected to the phrase “the village, the pleasure grove, and so on.”🔽The phrase “one becomes familiar with that” means that one becomes familiar with the sun’s rising and setting.

original: des zhes bya ba nyi mas nye bar mtshon pa de nyid phyogs yin no //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba nyi mas nye bar mtshon pa de nyid phyogs yin no //
translated: The phrase “in that direction” refers to the direction that is indicated by the sun.

original: don dang zhes bya ba shar dang nub la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dang zhes bya ba shar dang nub la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “in that place” means that the sun’s rising and setting are free of the characteristics of east and west.

original: shar dang nub la sogs ba'i don dang bral ba nyid ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: shar dang nub la sogs ba'i don dang bral ba nyid ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is it that the meaning of east and west, etc. is devoid of intrinsic reality?

original: de'i rang bzhin ma nges na 'o na ci ltar de ltar tha snyad byed snyam na 'on kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ma nges na 'o na ci ltar de ltar tha snyad byed snyam na 'on kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If its intrinsic reality is not ascertained, then how is it that such expressions are made?

original: song ba'i rjes su 'gro ba de la yod pa'i tshul ni song ba'i rjes su 'gro ba'i tshul te /
analyzed: song ba'i rjes su 'gro ba de la yod pa'i tshul ni song ba'i rjes su 'gro ba'i tshul te /
translated: The mode of existence of that which goes after the gone is the mode of going after the gone.

original: des yid nyams pa gang dag yin pa de dag gi dngos po ni nyid de des so //
analyzed: des yid nyams pa gang dag yin pa de dag gi dngos po ni nyid de des so //
translated: Those whose minds are impaired by that are the ones whose things are like that.

original: 'on te shar dang nub la sogs pa'i rtog pa ni thog ma med pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te shar dang nub la sogs pa'i rtog pa ni thog ma med pa yin te /
translated: But the conceptions of east and west, etc. are beginningless.

original: des na don dang 'brel pa'i phyir bden pa kho na'o snyam na /
analyzed: des na don dang 'brel pa'i phyir bden pa kho na'o snyam na /
translated: Therefore, since they are related to the object, they are true.

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you think that,

original: gal te thog ma med pa'i phyir shar dang nub la sogs pa'i rtogs pa rnams bden bar khas mi len na de'i tshe med pa thams cad mkhyen pa med do zhes de ltar rtogs pa rnams kyang bden par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te thog ma med pa'i phyir shar dang nub la sogs pa'i rtogs pa rnams bden bar khas mi len na de'i tshe med pa thams cad mkhyen pa med do zhes de ltar rtogs pa rnams kyang bden par 'gyur ro //
translated: then if you do not accept the truth of the conceptions of east and west, etc. because they are beginningless, then at that time the conceptions that all nonexistents are omniscient would also be true.

original: de ltar yin dang 'jig rten pa'i rtogs ba mtha' dag kyang tshad mar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar yin dang 'jig rten pa'i rtogs ba mtha' dag kyang tshad mar 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, all mundane knowledge would be valid cognition,

original: @56b thog ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @56b thog ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is without beginning.🔽If it is true because it is without beginning, then it follows, absurdly, that the conceptual thoughts of Isvara and so on are true,

original: gal te thog ma med pas bden pa yin na de'i tshe gang zhig dbang phyug gam gtso bo mi 'dod pa de'i ltar na yang dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa bden pa nyid du thal lo zhes brjod ba ni dbang phyug ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te thog ma med pas bden pa yin na de'i tshe gang zhig dbang phyug gam gtso bo mi 'dod pa de'i ltar na yang dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa bden pa nyid du thal lo zhes brjod ba ni dbang phyug ces bya ba'o //
translated: for there is no beginning to the conceptual thoughts of Isvara and so on.

original: 'di ni yul yin no snyam na ni tha snyad tsam du zad de dngos pos stong pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni yul yin no snyam na ni tha snyad tsam du zad de dngos pos stong pa yin no //
translated: If you think that the object of the conceptual thought of Isvara and so on is not true, then you are merely quibbling, for it is empty of entityness.

original: 'on te bstan bcos rnams thog ma med pa'i phyir bden pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'on te bstan bcos rnams thog ma med pa'i phyir bden pa nyid yin te /
translated: If you think that the treatises are true because they are without beginning,

original: des na de las 'ongs pa'i tha snyad ni bden pa kho na'o snyam na thog med ces smos so //
analyzed: des na de las 'ongs pa'i tha snyad ni bden pa kho na'o snyam na thog med ces smos so //
translated: then it follows, absurdly, that the conventions that arise from them are true.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?🔽The names that are set forth, such as “mutual,”

original: phan tshun zhes bya ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ming gang yin pa de bkod pa yin no //🔽ci'i don du zhe na //
analyzed: phan tshun zhes bya ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ming gang yin pa de bkod pa yin no //🔽ci'i don du zhe na //
translated: and so on,🔽are not the objects of the conceptual thought of Isvara and so on.

original: tha snyad kyi don du'o //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi don du'o //
translated: in terms of conventional objects.🔽The expression “this side” refers to the present.

original: nang gi tshu rol gyi phyogs la yang brjod pa ni /🔽'du byed pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nang gi tshu rol gyi phyogs la yang brjod pa ni / 'du byed pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The expression “that side” refers to the future.

original: gal te dus med na dngos po 'di ni da ltar ba'i dus can yin no zhes tha dad pa'i tha snyad du ci ltar 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: gal te dus med na dngos po 'di ni da ltar ba'i dus can yin no zhes tha dad pa'i tha snyad du ci ltar 'gyur snyam na /
translated: If time does not exist, how can one make the distinction that this entity is present?

original: tha dad pa zhes bya ba'o //🔽gal te gang gis tha dad par nye bar bstan pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid dus la sogs pa'i brjod pa la ston par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: tha dad pa zhes bya ba'o // gal te gang gis tha dad par nye bar bstan pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid dus la sogs pa'i brjod pa la ston par 'gyur ba /
translated: The expression “distinction” refers to the present.

original: dus med pa nyid du ci ltar grub snyam na /
analyzed: dus med pa nyid du ci ltar grub snyam na /
translated: If the nature of an entity is revealed by the distinction, how can one establish that time does not exist?

original: 'di ltar zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes smos so //
translated: The expression “in this way” refers to the following.

original: gal te byung bar gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rtogs pa dag las 'das pa la sogs pa'i dus su lhas byin la sogs pa gnas pa yin na de'i tshe dus de byung bar gyur to zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rtog pa las kyang dus
analyzed: gal te byung bar gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rtogs pa dag las 'das pa la sogs pa'i dus su lhas byin la sogs pa gnas pa yin na de'i tshe dus de byung bar gyur to zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rtog pa las kyang dus
translated: If Devadatta exists in the past, etc., on the basis of the cognitions “he was,” “he will be,” etc., then at that time, on the basis of the cognitions “he was,” “he will be,” etc.,

original: kyang dus gzhan na gnas par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: kyang dus gzhan na gnas par 'gyur zhing /
translated: he would exist in another time.

original: de bzhin du dus gzhan yang dus gzhan la gnas par 'gyur ba'i phyir thug pa med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du dus gzhan yang dus gzhan la gnas par 'gyur ba'i phyir thug pa med do //
translated: Likewise, since time would be located in another time, there would be an infinite regress.

original: phyogs kyang de bzhin te shar la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rang gi ngo bos yin gyi /
analyzed: phyogs kyang de bzhin te shar la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rang gi ngo bos yin gyi /
translated: The same applies to directions, since the nature of the east, etc., is by its very essence,

original: yul gzhan la ltos nas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba sbyar ro //
analyzed: yul gzhan la ltos nas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba sbyar ro //
translated: and not in dependence on other objects.

original: des na rang gi ngo bor gyur pa'i chos tha dad pas de ltar tha snyad byed pa yin no //
analyzed: des na rang gi ngo bor gyur pa'i chos tha dad pas de ltar tha snyad byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the phenomena that are its very essence are different, it is conventionally designated in that way.

original: tha snyad kyi tshul bstan pa ni /
analyzed: tha snyad kyi tshul bstan pa ni /
translated: The mode of convention is taught:

original: shar ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shar ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “The east” and so on.

original: de dang zhes bya ba dus la sogs pa dang 'brel pa'i'o //
analyzed: de dang zhes bya ba dus la sogs pa dang 'brel pa'i'o //
translated: “That” refers to the connection with time, etc.

original: gal te dus kyi 'das pa nyid dngos po la ltos pa yin na de'i tshe dngos pa'i 'das pa nyid kyang dus la ltos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te dus kyi 'das pa nyid dngos po la ltos pa yin na de'i tshe dngos pa'i 'das pa nyid kyang dus la ltos par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the pastness of time depends on things, then the pastness of things would depend on time.

original: de ltar gyur na ci skyon snyam na /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na ci skyon snyam na /
translated: If that were the case, what would be the problem?

original: phan tshun zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phan tshun zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Mutually” and so on.

original: gcig kyang zhes bya ba dus sam dngos po yang 'das pa nyid du gnas pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig kyang zhes bya ba dus sam dngos po yang 'das pa nyid du gnas pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: “Even one” means that time or things would not exist as past.

original: 'di'i dogs pa bsu ba ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //🔽yun ring por 'das @57a * //
analyzed: 'di'i dogs pa bsu ba ni gal te zhes bya ba'o // yun ring por 'das @57a * //
translated: The objection is anticipated: “If the object and the time are simultaneous,

original: pa'i don dang dus dag cig car 'das ba nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: pa'i don dang dus dag cig car 'das ba nyid yin gyi /
translated: then the object and the time are both past.

original: gang gi phan tshun brten ba'i nyes bar 'gyur ba rim gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phan tshun brten ba'i nyes bar 'gyur ba rim gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: But if they are sequential, then there is the fault of mutual dependence.

original: lan ni 'das pa nyid thug ba med bar 'gyur zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: lan ni 'das pa nyid thug ba med bar 'gyur zhes sbyar ro //
translated: The response is that “the past would be endless.”

original: ci ltar thug ba med snyam na /
analyzed: ci ltar thug ba med snyam na /
translated: How would it be endless?

original: cig car zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: cig car zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Simultaneously” is supplied.

original: gnyis dag ces bya ba ni yun ring mor 'das pa'i don dang dus dag go //
analyzed: gnyis dag ces bya ba ni yun ring mor 'das pa'i don dang dus dag go //
translated: “The two” refers to the object and the time that are long past.

original: des na ci ltar cig car nyid phan tshun 'das par 'gyur snyam du bsam pa'o //
analyzed: des na ci ltar cig car nyid phan tshun 'das par 'gyur snyam du bsam pa'o //
translated: How could they be simultaneous and past in relation to each other?

original: dogs pa bsu ba ni de dag ces bya ba ste cig car ba'i yun ring por 'das ba'i don dang dus dag gzhan la 'das pa yin na'o //
analyzed: dogs pa bsu ba ni de dag ces bya ba ste cig car ba'i yun ring por 'das ba'i don dang dus dag gzhan la 'das pa yin na'o //
translated: The objection is anticipated: “If the object and the time that are long past are past in relation to another,

original: lan ni de la'ang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni de la'ang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then the response is that ‘the other would be endless.’

original: gzhan gyis 'das pa yang de las gzhan las /
analyzed: gzhan gyis 'das pa yang de las gzhan las /
translated: The other that is past would be past in relation to another.

original: de'i yang de las gzhan las yin pa'i phyir 'das pa nyid thug pa med bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i yang de las gzhan las yin pa'i phyir 'das pa nyid thug pa med bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and that would be due to something other than that, so the past would be without end.

original: des na dus la sogs pa ni med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des na dus la sogs pa ni med pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore time and so on do not exist.

original: des na tha dad ba'i nye bar bstan pa'i rang bzhin de nyid dus la sogs pa'i brjod pa la ston pa yin no zhes gnas so ;
analyzed: des na tha dad ba'i nye bar bstan pa'i rang bzhin de nyid dus la sogs pa'i brjod pa la ston pa yin no zhes gnas so ;
translated: Therefore, the very nature of the distinct demonstration is the teaching in the expression of time and so on.

original: / de ltar nam mkha' dgag pa'i zhar la yul dang dus dag bkag nas /
analyzed: / de ltar nam mkha' dgag pa'i zhar la yul dang dus dag bkag nas /
translated: Thus, having incidentally refuted space, time and so on are refuted.

original: yang dus la yon tan med par brjod pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang dus la yon tan med par brjod pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The expression of the absence of qualities in time is stated in the line “Moreover, . . .”

original: bdag la sogs pa la yang de bzhin du yon tan gang yin par brjod par bya /
analyzed: bdag la sogs pa la yang de bzhin du yon tan gang yin par brjod par bya /
translated: One should say that the qualities of self and so on are also like that.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: “Or” is the opponent’s position.

original: lan ni de ni zhes bya ba ste /🔽chen po nyid la sogs pa ni'o //
analyzed: lan ni de ni zhes bya ba ste / chen po nyid la sogs pa ni'o //
translated: The response is stated in the line “That is not so.”🔽“Greatness” and so on are the qualities of the self.

original: des bdag la sogs pa rnams kyi bdag nyid kyi so sor nges ba 'ga' zhig brjod par bya ba ste /
analyzed: des bdag la sogs pa rnams kyi bdag nyid kyi so sor nges ba 'ga' zhig brjod par bya ba ste /
