translated: One should say that the self and so on have some specific nature of their own.

original: de ltar ma yin na bdag dang dus gnyis tha dad par rnam bar gzhag pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na bdag dang dus gnyis tha dad par rnam bar gzhag pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, then self and time would not be established as different.

original: gnang ba ni dngos po'i bdag nyid thob pa yod pa yin la /
analyzed: gnang ba ni dngos po'i bdag nyid thob pa yod pa yin la /
translated: The allowance is the existence of the attainment of the nature of things.

original: 'gog pa ni de med pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa ni de med pa'o //
translated: The prohibition is the nonexistence of that.

original: de skad du yang /🔽dus kyis 'byung po smin byed de /
analyzed: de skad du yang / dus kyis 'byung po smin byed de /
translated: And it is said:🔽Time ripens beings;

original: dus kyis skye dgu 'jig par byed //
analyzed: dus kyis skye dgu 'jig par byed //
translated: time destroys beings.

original: ces brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: ces brjod pa yin no //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: sman pa ni skyed par byed pa ste gnas bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: sman pa ni skyed par byed pa ste gnas bar byed pa'o //
translated: The doctor is the producer, the maintainer.

original: 'jig ba ni med par byed pa ste 'gog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig ba ni med par byed pa ste 'gog par byed pa'o //
translated: Destruction is the nonexistence, the cessation.

original: de gnyis ni dus kyi yon tan yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de gnyis ni dus kyi yon tan yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: These two are the qualities of time.

original: lan ni de dag ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni de dag ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reply is “They are not.”

original: de'i phyir dus kyis ni gnas pa dang 'gog par mi theg go //
analyzed: de'i phyir dus kyis ni gnas pa dang 'gog par mi theg go //
translated: Therefore, time cannot maintain or destroy.

original: yang na yin mod /
analyzed: yang na yin mod /
translated: Or, it is possible,

original: de lta na yang bdag la sogs pa las tha dad pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de lta na yang bdag la sogs pa las tha dad pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: but even so, it is not different from self and so on.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement is “Moreover.”

original: gal te dus khyab ba dang rtags kyis kyang gnas pa dang bkag ba nus na ni /
analyzed: gal te dus khyab ba dang rtags kyis kyang gnas pa dang bkag ba nus na ni /
translated: If time pervades and also has the capacity to stop and to allow,

original: @57b de'i tshe bdag kyang de ltar nus pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @57b de'i tshe bdag kyang de ltar nus pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: then at that time, the self would also obtain the capacity to do that.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: 'dod pa'i dus las gzhan bdag la khyab pa dang rtag pa nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i dus las gzhan bdag la khyab pa dang rtag pa nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no difference between the self and time in terms of pervasiveness and permanence.

original: ci ltar khyad par med snyam na /
analyzed: ci ltar khyad par med snyam na /
translated: How is there no difference?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is like this.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni dus kyis so //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni dus kyis so //
translated: This is by time.

original: 'dis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bdag la sogs pas so //
analyzed: 'dis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bdag la sogs pas so //
translated: This is not by the self and so on.

original: de ltar nam mkha' la sogs pa bkag nas /
analyzed: de ltar nam mkha' la sogs pa bkag nas /
translated: Thus, having refuted space and so on,

original: sgra nam mkha'i ma yin na tshad ma dang 'gal bar yang zhes gang brjod pa de la grub pa'i mtha'i mjug sdud pa ni /
analyzed: sgra nam mkha'i ma yin na tshad ma dang 'gal bar yang zhes gang brjod pa de la grub pa'i mtha'i mjug sdud pa ni /
translated: it is said that if sound is not space, it contradicts valid cognition. The conclusion of the philosophical position is stated:

original: des na zhes bya ba'o //🔽'di ni nam mkha' nyid du zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba'o // 'di ni nam mkha' nyid du zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'o //
translated: Therefore.🔽This is space.

original: 'di ni sgra ste rtogs na'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sgra ste rtogs na'o //
translated: This is sound.

original: lan ni 'bar sogs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni 'bar sogs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reply is: Burning and so on.

original: mthong ba min nam zhes bya ba ni mthong ba kho na'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mthong ba min nam zhes bya ba ni mthong ba kho na'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Isn’t it seen?” means “it is seen.”

original: de ltar yin na yang /
analyzed: de ltar yin na yang /
translated: Even though this is so,

original: ci na ste ci'i phyir 'bar ba la sogs pa ste nam mkha' de'i yon tan du mi brjod /
analyzed: ci na ste ci'i phyir 'bar ba la sogs pa ste nam mkha' de'i yon tan du mi brjod /
translated: why is it that the blazing, etc., are not said to be the qualities of space?

original: dogs pa ni de zhes bya ba 'bar ba la sogs pa de la rten nam mkha' las gzhan yang yod ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: dogs pa ni de zhes bya ba 'bar ba la sogs pa de la rten nam mkha' las gzhan yang yod ces bya ba'o //
translated: The doubt is that there is something other than space, which is the basis of the blazing, etc.

original: lan ni 'thad pa min te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni 'thad pa min te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is that this is not tenable.

original: yang na nam mkha' yod du chug kyang des gnas par byed pa ni ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni nam mkha' ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang na nam mkha' yod du chug kyang des gnas par byed pa ni ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni nam mkha' ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Or, even if space exists, it does not serve as a basis.

original: nam mkha' de ma brtags par yod pa kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: nam mkha' de ma brtags par yod pa kho na yin gyi /
translated: Space exists only if it is not examined.

original: don dam par yod pa ni ma yin no zhes ston pa ni snang ba yod na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don dam par yod pa ni ma yin no zhes ston pa ni snang ba yod na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It does not exist ultimately. This is demonstrated by the words “if light exists.”

original: 'di ni nye bar mtshon pa ste mun pa yod na yang zhes rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni nye bar mtshon pa ste mun pa yod na yang zhes rtogs par bya'o //
translated: This is an illustration; darkness should be understood in the same way.

original: de'i phyir rang nyid smos pa ni bstan bcos byed pa'i 'dod pa bsgrub par bya ba yin pa spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang nyid smos pa ni bstan bcos byed pa'i 'dod pa bsgrub par bya ba yin pa spangs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the statement of the author is not for the purpose of establishing the desire of the treatise author.

original: bstan bcos byed pa'i 'dod pa bsgrub par bya ba yin na /🔽slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po'i gzhung 'chad pa po rnams kyang ltar /
analyzed: bstan bcos byed pa'i 'dod pa bsgrub par bya ba yin na / slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po'i gzhung 'chad pa po rnams kyang ltar /
translated: If it were for the purpose of establishing the desire of the treatise author,

original: rang nyid smos pa don med par 'gyur ro zhes sun 'byin pa gzhan brjod pa ni /🔽gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang nyid smos pa don med par 'gyur ro zhes sun 'byin pa gzhan brjod pa ni / gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then it would be pointless for the commentators on the treatises of Master Dignaga to state themselves,🔽as they would be refuting the desire of the treatise author.

original: gal te bstan bcos byed pa'i 'dod pa yang rang nyid smos pas ston pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te bstan bcos byed pa'i 'dod pa yang rang nyid smos pas ston pa yin na /
translated: Moreover, if the desire of the treatise author were indicated by stating himself,

original: de'i tshe rang nyid smos pa yang don med par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: de'i tshe rang nyid smos pa yang don med par 'gyur ro ;
translated: then the statement of himself would be pointless.

original: / ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: / ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: gang gi phyir phyogs kyi mtshan nyid las phyi rol gyi don can yin pas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir phyogs kyi mtshan nyid las phyi rol gyi don can yin pas so //
translated: Because it is external to the definition of a position.

original: mtshan nyid byed pa ni log par rtogs pa bsal ba'i don du yin na /
analyzed: mtshan nyid byed pa ni log par rtogs pa bsal ba'i don du yin na /
translated: If the definition is for the purpose of dispelling misconceptions,

original: bstan bcos byed pa'i 'dod ba bsgrub par bya ba nyid du khas len na ni rang nyid sgra ma 'brel par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bstan bcos byed pa'i 'dod ba bsgrub par bya ba nyid du khas len na ni rang nyid sgra ma 'brel par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you accept that the desire to compose a treatise is itself the probandum, then you yourself are not related to the thesis.

original: @58a * // 'chad pa ni rang nyid kyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: @58a * // 'chad pa ni rang nyid kyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word himself is the explanation.

original: de zhes bya ba bstan bcos byed ba'i 'dod pa bzlog pa'i don nyid do //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba bstan bcos byed ba'i 'dod pa bzlog pa'i don nyid do //
translated: The word that refers to the very object of the desire to compose a treatise that is being refuted.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos byed pa'i 'dod ba yang ngo //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos byed pa'i 'dod ba yang ngo //
translated: The word also refers to the desire to compose a treatise.

original: de zhes bya ba ni rang nyid smos pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni rang nyid smos pa'o //
translated: The word that refers to himself.

original: ci'i phyir snyam na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir snyam na /
translated: Why?

original: de ltar yin na zhes smos te /
analyzed: de ltar yin na zhes smos te /
translated: The word if is stated.

original: bstan bcos byed pa 'dod pa yang bsgrub bya yin na'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos byed pa 'dod pa yang bsgrub bya yin na'o //
translated: If the desire to compose a treatise is also the probandum,🔽it is stated that then.

original: phyogs kyi mtshan nyid kyi don log par rtogs pa bsal ba ste /
analyzed: phyogs kyi mtshan nyid kyi don log par rtogs pa bsal ba ste /
translated: The meaning of the characteristic of the position is understood incorrectly, and that is eliminated.

original: de dang ma 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang ma 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not related to that.

original: rang nyid kyi sgra'i dgos pa gzhan yin par dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: rang nyid kyi sgra'i dgos pa gzhan yin par dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: The doubt that the purpose of the word himself is something else is anticipated:

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is said....

original: lan ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is Then....

original: bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is the thought:

original: gal te 'ga' zhig gis bstan bcos byed pa'i 'dod pa bsgrub par bya ba ma yin no zhes brjod na /
analyzed: gal te 'ga' zhig gis bstan bcos byed pa'i 'dod pa bsgrub par bya ba ma yin no zhes brjod na /
translated: If someone says, “The desire to compose treatises is not to be established,”

original: de'i tshe bstan bcos byed bas 'dod pa bsgrub bar bya ba ma yin no zhes dogs par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de'i tshe bstan bcos byed bas 'dod pa bsgrub bar bya ba ma yin no zhes dogs par 'gyur gyi /
translated: then at that time the author of the treatise would doubt that the desire to compose treatises is not to be established.

original: gang gi tshe thams cad kyis kyang bstan bcos byed pa'i 'dod pa bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes khas blangs pa de'i tshe bzlog par ga la dogs /
analyzed: gang gi tshe thams cad kyis kyang bstan bcos byed pa'i 'dod pa bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes khas blangs pa de'i tshe bzlog par ga la dogs /
translated: But when everyone accepts that the desire to compose treatises is to be established, how can one doubt that it is to be refuted?

original: des na rang nyid smos pa 'dod pa bzlog pa'i don du byas pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: des na rang nyid smos pa 'dod pa bzlog pa'i don du byas pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that the author himself is the object of the refutation of desire.

original: gang zhig rang nyid smos pas bstan bcos dag la 'dod pas 'jug par bya ba'i rtog pa sngon du gtong ba de tshad mas 'gog pa ma yin pa'am 'gog pa la yin /
analyzed: gang zhig rang nyid smos pas bstan bcos dag la 'dod pas 'jug par bya ba'i rtog pa sngon du gtong ba de tshad mas 'gog pa ma yin pa'am 'gog pa la yin /
translated: If someone, by mentioning the author himself, entertains the idea that treatises should be engaged through desire, is that refuted by valid knowledge or not?

original: de la gal te tshad ma mi 'gog na /
analyzed: de la gal te tshad ma mi 'gog na /
translated: If valid knowledge does not refute it,🔽then it is not refuted.

original: de'i tshe gang gis rang nyid smos pas gzhug par bya ba bstan bcos 'dzin pa sus bzlog /'o na tshad mas bkag na de'i tshe yang gang gis rang nyid smos pas don dang bcas par 'gyur ba tshig las rgol ba gang gis 'jug / rtog pa dang ldan
analyzed: de'i tshe gang gis rang nyid smos pas gzhug par bya ba bstan bcos 'dzin pa sus bzlog /'o na tshad mas bkag na de'i tshe yang gang gis rang nyid smos pas don dang bcas par 'gyur ba tshig las rgol ba gang gis 'jug / rtog pa dang ldan
translated: At that time, who would refute the one who holds the treatise, who is to be engaged by the one who mentions himself? But if it is refuted by a valid cognition, then at that time, by what means of refuting words that have meaning by mentioning oneself, would one engage?

original: pa'i 'dod pa yang tshad ma'i rtsa ba can kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: pa'i 'dod pa yang tshad ma'i rtsa ba can kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that even the assertions of the one who possesses conceptual thought are only rooted in valid cognition.

original: 'on te rtog pa sngon du byed pa ma yin pa 'jug pa'i don du rang nyid smos so snyam du dogs na de dag cis gsungs so //
analyzed: 'on te rtog pa sngon du byed pa ma yin pa 'jug pa'i don du rang nyid smos so snyam du dogs na de dag cis gsungs so //
translated: But if you suspect that one mentions oneself for the purpose of engaging without prior conceptual thought, then why did they say that?

original: cis mi 'thob ste 'thob pa kho na 'dod pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cis mi 'thob ste 'thob pa kho na 'dod pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is it not obtained? It is only obtained because of the desire for existence.

original: des na rtog pa sngon du byed pa ma yin par 'jug pa'i don du yang rang nyid smos pa don med do //
analyzed: des na rtog pa sngon du byed pa ma yin par 'jug pa'i don du yang rang nyid smos pa don med do //
translated: Therefore, even for the purpose of engaging without prior conceptual thought, mentioning oneself is meaningless.

original: des na rang nyid kyi sgra ni phyogs kyi mtshan nyid las phyi rol du gyur pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des na rang nyid kyi sgra ni phyogs kyi mtshan nyid las phyi rol du gyur pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, the word oneself is only external to the definition of a position.

original: 'dis ni / gal te bstan bcos 'dod 'jug don //
analyzed: 'dis ni / gal te bstan bcos 'dod 'jug don //
translated: If one enters the treatise out of desire,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gsal bar ma bshad pas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gsal bar ma bshad pas /
translated: and ending with:

original: da ni tshad mas bkag med na //
analyzed: da ni tshad mas bkag med na //
translated: If one enters the treatise out of desire,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam par bskal pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam par bskal pa yin no //
translated: and ending with:🔽If one enters the treatise out of desire,🔽and ending with:🔽If one enters the treatise out of desire,🔽and ending with:🔽If one enters the treatise out of desire,

original: lung thams @58b cad la yongs su brtags nas 'jug pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: lung thams @58b cad la yongs su brtags nas 'jug pa'i phyir na /
translated: and ending with:🔽If one enters the treatise out of desire,🔽and ending with:🔽If one enters the treatise out of desire,🔽and ending with:🔽If one enters the treatise out of desire,

original: so sor nges pa'i lang la 'jug par bya ba'i don du rang nyid smos pa yin no snyam na bstan bcos thams cad ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: so sor nges pa'i lang la 'jug par bya ba'i don du rang nyid smos pa yin no snyam na bstan bcos thams cad ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: and ending with:🔽If one enters the treatise out of desire,

original: des ni zhes bya ba ni rnam par dpyad mi bzod pas na'o //
analyzed: des ni zhes bya ba ni rnam par dpyad mi bzod pas na'o //
translated: and ending with:🔽If one enters the treatise out of desire,

original: de ni tshad mas gnod pa'ang yin la /
analyzed: de ni tshad mas gnod pa'ang yin la /
translated: and ending with:🔽If one enters the treatise out of desire,

original: de nyid kyis na yongs su ma dag pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na yongs su ma dag pa yin te /
translated: and ending with:🔽If one enters the treatise out of desire,🔽and ending with:

original: de lta bu'i bstan bcos las 'jug pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta bu'i bstan bcos las 'jug pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: If one enters the treatise out of desire,🔽and ending with:🔽If one enters the treatise out of desire,🔽and ending with:🔽If one enters the treatise out of desire,🔽and ending with:

original: de bas na rang nyid smos bas bstan bcos gal 'jug pa gang yin ba de gal srid de mi srid ba kho na'o //
analyzed: de bas na rang nyid smos bas bstan bcos gal 'jug pa gang yin ba de gal srid de mi srid ba kho na'o //
translated: If one enters the treatise out of desire,🔽and ending with:🔽If one enters the treatise out of desire,🔽and ending with:🔽If one enters the treatise out of desire,🔽and ending with:🔽If one enters the treatise out of desire,🔽and ending with:🔽If one enters the treatise out of desire,🔽and ending with:🔽If one enters the treatise out of desire,🔽and ending with:🔽If one enters the treatise out of desire,🔽and ending with:🔽If one enters the treatise out of desire,🔽and ending with:🔽If one enters the treatise out of desire,🔽and ending with:🔽If one enters the treatise out of desire,🔽and ending with:🔽If one enters the treatise out of desire,🔽and ending with:🔽If one enters the treatise out of desire,🔽and ending with:🔽If one enters the treatise out of desire,🔽and ending with:🔽If one enters the treatise out of desire,🔽and ending with:🔽If one enters the treatise out of desire,🔽and ending with:🔽If one enters the treatise out of desire,🔽and ending with:🔽If one enters the treatise out of desire,🔽and ending with:🔽If one enters the treatise out of desire,🔽and ending with:

original: 'di ni gal te tshad mas bkag na /
analyzed: 'di ni gal te tshad mas bkag na /
translated: If one enters the treatise out

original: yang zhes bya ba'i rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa yin no //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa yin no //
translated: The commentary on the above verse is the Commentary on the Analysis of Relations.

original: da ni rnam 'grel lhag ma rnam par 'grel pa ni /
analyzed: da ni rnam 'grel lhag ma rnam par 'grel pa ni /
translated: Now, the remainder of the Analysis is commented on:

original: gal te rtog ldan min na ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te rtog ldan min na ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is not endowed with thought,

original: dang po ni 'dod pas bstan bcos khas len la /
analyzed: dang po ni 'dod pas bstan bcos khas len la /
translated: The first is the assertion of the treatise,

original: gnyis par ni rang nyid smos ba las yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis par ni rang nyid smos ba las yin no zhe na /
translated: and the second is from the statement of itself.

original: de ni dang po zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni dang po zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the first.

original: de tsam ni 'dod pa tsam ste des zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de tsam ni 'dod pa tsam ste des zhugs pa'o //
translated: That much is mere assertion, and it is engaged in that.

original: des na ni 'dod pas na'o //
analyzed: des na ni 'dod pas na'o //
translated: Therefore, it is because of assertion.

original: de bzhin du ni dang po khas blangs pa bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ni dang po khas blangs pa bzhin du'o //
translated: Just like that is just like the first assertion.

original: de'i phyir rtog pa gnyi ga la ltos nas kyang rang nyid smos pa don med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rtog pa gnyi ga la ltos nas kyang rang nyid smos pa don med pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, in terms of both thoughts, the statement of itself is meaningless.

original: de dag don du zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu ba'o //
analyzed: de dag don du zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu ba'o //
translated: As for “for the sake of those,” this is anticipating an objection.

original: 'dod pas bstan bcos dag la 'jug par bya ba'i don du de dag rang nyid smos pa'i rang bzhin gyis slob pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod pas bstan bcos dag la 'jug par bya ba'i don du de dag rang nyid smos pa'i rang bzhin gyis slob pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is said that the statement of itself is for the sake of engaging in the treatises through assertion, it is a learner because of its nature.

original: lan ni 'dod pa tsam gyis ni bstan bcos la 'jug pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: lan ni 'dod pa tsam gyis ni bstan bcos la 'jug pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The answer is: One does not enter into the treatise merely by desire,

original: 'on kyang yongs su brtags pas yin no zhes rtogs par bya ba de bslab par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang yongs su brtags pas yin no zhes rtogs par bya ba de bslab par bya ba yin no //
translated: but rather by thorough investigation. This is what should be learned.

original: 'di nyid 'chad pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid 'chad pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is explained: If,

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i rnam pa brjod pa ni snga ma bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i rnam pa brjod pa ni snga ma bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: as before, one states the form of the probandum,

original: 'dir zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos khas blangs pa la'o zhes de ltar rigs pa bstan par rigs so //
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos khas blangs pa la'o zhes de ltar rigs pa bstan par rigs so //
translated: then one should state the reasoning in this way: “Here, in the treatise, one should accept that the treatise is to be entered by thorough investigation, and not by desire alone.”

original: ci ltar gyur pa zhig ce na /
analyzed: ci ltar gyur pa zhig ce na /
translated: What is the problem?

original: 'dod pas zhes bya ba'o /
analyzed: 'dod pas zhes bya ba'o /
translated: Desire.

original: // / tshad ma rgyan gyi t'i ka ba ma po drug cu rtsa drug pa gzhan dag rgol ba'i 'dod pa yang tshad ma dang / gzhan dag kho nas len pa dang 'dor bar 'gyur pa yin pas na rang nyid smos pas ci bya zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: // / tshad ma rgyan gyi t'i ka ba ma po drug cu rtsa drug pa gzhan dag rgol ba'i 'dod pa yang tshad ma dang / gzhan dag kho nas len pa dang 'dor bar 'gyur pa yin pas na rang nyid smos pas ci bya zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: Others object: “Since others alone would accept and reject the valid cognitions and the objects of affirmation of the treatise, what is the use of stating your own position?”

original: de lta na 'on zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta na 'on zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In response, it is said: “In that case, then . . .”

original: gal te rgol ba'i 'dod pa la tshad mas gnod na zhes skabs yin no //
analyzed: gal te rgol ba'i 'dod pa la tshad mas gnod na zhes skabs yin no //
translated: If the opponent's thesis is contradicted by a valid cognition, then the thesis is not established.

original: 'di yang mi nus pa dang mi dgos pa nyid nyes pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽'dod pa mi rtag pa nyid la gnod @59a * //
analyzed: 'di yang mi nus pa dang mi dgos pa nyid nyes pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // 'dod pa mi rtag pa nyid la gnod @59a * //
translated: This is also a fault, because it is impossible and unnecessary.

original: pa med de mi 'gal ba'i phyir dang / mi 'gal ba yang bstan bcos byed pa'i 'dod pa med na mi 'byung ba ma yin ba'i phyir ro //🔽bsgrub bar bya ba min pa ni bstan bcos byed ba'i 'dod ba ste /
analyzed: pa med de mi 'gal ba'i phyir dang / mi 'gal ba yang bstan bcos byed pa'i 'dod pa med na mi 'byung ba ma yin ba'i phyir ro // bsgrub bar bya ba min pa ni bstan bcos byed ba'i 'dod ba ste /
translated: The thesis of impermanence is not contradicted, because there is no contradiction, and because the absence of contradiction is not dependent on the desire of the author of the treatise.

original: med na mi 'byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The thesis is not to be established, because it is not dependent on the desire of the author of the treatise.

original: med na mi 'byung ba ma yin yang bstan bcos las 'dod pa bsgrub par bya ba yin na thug pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba ma yin yang bstan bcos las 'dod pa bsgrub par bya ba yin na thug pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: It is not dependent, but if the desire of the treatise is to establish the thesis, there would be an infinite regress,

original: gtan tshigs thams cad la skur bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs thams cad la skur bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because all reasons would be denied.

original: 'dod pa la gnod pa med pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdor gzhag ba'i ngag rnam par 'grel ba ni /
analyzed: 'dod pa la gnod pa med pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdor gzhag ba'i ngag rnam par 'grel ba ni /
translated: The words the thesis is not contradicted by a valid cognition and so on are explained in the treatise.

original: bstan bcos las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Treatise refers to the Pramanavarttika.

original: bsgrub bya yin la zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i yon tan nyid do //
analyzed: bsgrub bya yin la zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i yon tan nyid do //
translated: “That which is to be established” is the quality of space.

original: de sgrub na zhes bya ba nam mkha'i yon tan sgrub na'o //
analyzed: de sgrub na zhes bya ba nam mkha'i yon tan sgrub na'o //
translated: “If it were established” means if the quality of space were established.

original: des na 'di ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de lta na 'on zhes bya ba la sogs pa brtsad pa'o //
analyzed: des na 'di ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de lta na 'on zhes bya ba la sogs pa brtsad pa'o //
translated: “Therefore, this is not so” means that if it were so, then the opponent’s objection would be as follows.

original: de ltar log bar rtogs pa bsal ba'i sgo nas dogs pa'i gnas bzlog pa'i don yin pa'i phyir rang smos pa don med pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar log bar rtogs pa bsal ba'i sgo nas dogs pa'i gnas bzlog pa'i don yin pa'i phyir rang smos pa don med pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, since the purpose of the statement of the opponent’s objection is to remove doubts by dispelling wrong views, it is not meaningless to state the opponent’s view.

original: rang gi phyogs pa 'ga' zhig ma grub pa'i nyes par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rang gi phyogs pa 'ga' zhig ma grub pa'i nyes par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Some of our own schools say that it is meaningless to state the opponent’s view because it would be a fault to establish something that is not established.

original: gzhung lugs kyis nye bar bkod pa'i chos can la sgrub par byed na mi srid pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: gzhung lugs kyis nye bar bkod pa'i chos can la sgrub par byed na mi srid pa'i phyir na /
translated: Since it is impossible to establish a subject that is set forth in a treatise,🔽it is necessary to abandon that and to take as the subject something that is established by a valid cognition.

original: de yongs su spangs te chos can tshad mas grub ba gzung bar bya ba yin no zhes shes par bya ba'i don du rang nyid smos pa yin no zhes brjod ba ni /
analyzed: de yongs su spangs te chos can tshad mas grub ba gzung bar bya ba yin no zhes shes par bya ba'i don du rang nyid smos pa yin no zhes brjod ba ni /
translated: The statement “The author himself states his own view in order to make this known”

original: gzhung lugs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhung lugs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: is the treatise.

original: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba bstan bcos kyis gzhag ba na'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba bstan bcos kyis gzhag ba na'o //
translated: “By another” refers to the treatise.

original: gal te dngos po la brten pa'i rnam par dpyod pa ni /
analyzed: gal te dngos po la brten pa'i rnam par dpyod pa ni /
translated: If the analysis is based on entities,🔽since it is established in the scriptures, it is not the case that it is not established with respect to non-entities. So what is the point of stating “itself”?

original: gzhung lugs las grub pa dngos po ma yin ba la ma grub pa'i phyir na rang nyid du mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam de'i don du rang nyid smos pas ci bya zhes brjod pa ni dpyad ba nyid kyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhung lugs las grub pa dngos po ma yin ba la ma grub pa'i phyir na rang nyid du mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam de'i don du rang nyid smos pas ci bya zhes brjod pa ni dpyad ba nyid kyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to this is “since it is itself the analysis.”

original: byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i sgrub byed 'di ni mngon bar 'dod pa'i bsgrub bya sgrub pa'i don du rab tu sbyar ba yin pas /
analyzed: byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i sgrub byed 'di ni mngon bar 'dod pa'i bsgrub bya sgrub pa'i don du rab tu sbyar ba yin pas /
translated: Since this proof, “because it is produced,” is applied for the purpose of proving the probandum that is explicitly stated,

original: rang grub pa'i don du tshad mas grub pa'i chos can 'phen pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang grub pa'i don du tshad mas grub pa'i chos can 'phen pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: it is the property of the subject that is established by a valid cognition for the purpose of establishing itself.

original: bstan bcos 'ba' zhig gis grub pa'i chos can la ni mngon par 'dod pa 'grub pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: bstan bcos 'ba' zhig gis grub pa'i chos can la ni mngon par 'dod pa 'grub pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: The response to this is “since there is no establishment of the desired conclusion with respect to a subject that is established by the treatise alone.”

original: rang 'dod brtags pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang 'dod brtags pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to this is “since it is imputed by one’s own desire.”

original: de'i rang bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni rang bzhin gang gis chos can yin ba gang yin pa de la @59b ni zhes bya ba ni sgra la sogs pa'i chos can no //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni rang bzhin gang gis chos can yin ba gang yin pa de la @59b ni zhes bya ba ni sgra la sogs pa'i chos can no //
translated: The phrase the nature of that refers to the nature by which something is a subject. The phrase that is refers to the subject, sound, etc.

original: dogs pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dogs pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase it might be thought introduces a doubt.

original: des na sgra'i rang bzhin ni rnam par dpyad pa ma yin ba des na de la sgrub bar byed pa srid ba'i phyir nam mkha'i yon tan nyid grub pa kho na'o zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: des na sgra'i rang bzhin ni rnam par dpyad pa ma yin ba des na de la sgrub bar byed pa srid ba'i phyir nam mkha'i yon tan nyid grub pa kho na'o zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: The thought is this: Since the nature of sound is not investigated, it is possible to establish it. Therefore, the quality of sound, namely, its being a quality of space, is certainly established.

original: lan ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is the phrase Well then.

original: ma grub pa'i khyad par nam mkha'i yon tan nyid blangs bas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: ma grub pa'i khyad par nam mkha'i yon tan nyid blangs bas ci zhig bya /
translated: What is the point of taking up the unestablished distinction that sound is a quality of space?

original: de lta bu nyid ces bya ba ni khyad par ma grub pa'i sgra nyid do //
analyzed: de lta bu nyid ces bya ba ni khyad par ma grub pa'i sgra nyid do //
translated: The phrase just that refers to the unestablished distinction of sound.

original: der ni nam mkha'i yon tan gyi khyad par can gyi sgra la mi rtag ba nyid med ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: der ni nam mkha'i yon tan gyi khyad par can gyi sgra la mi rtag ba nyid med ba'i phyir te /
translated: The phrase there is no impermanence in sound that has the distinction of being a quality of space is a response to that.

original: don du mi gnyer ba'i phyir ni rgol ba'i tshig don med do zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: don du mi gnyer ba'i phyir ni rgol ba'i tshig don med do zhes 'brel to //
translated: The phrase because it is not desired is connected to the statement the opponent's words are meaningless.

original: ci brjod pa snyam na nam mkha'i yon tan dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: ci brjod pa snyam na nam mkha'i yon tan dang ldan pa'o //
translated: If you think, “What is it that is said? ” [the answer is:] it is endowed with the quality of space.

original: 'on te rgol ba'i tshig las de 'grub na ci ltar rgol ba'i tshig don med snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te rgol ba'i tshig las de 'grub na ci ltar rgol ba'i tshig don med snyam na /
translated: If you think, “But if that is established from the words of the opponent, how are the words of the opponent meaningless? ”

original: de las zhes smos te dam bca' ba tsam las so //
analyzed: de las zhes smos te dam bca' ba tsam las so //
translated: [The response is:] “from that” means from the mere thesis.

original: de zhes bya ba mngon bar 'dod pa ma yin ba nam mkha'i yon tan ldan ba'i mi rtag pa grub pa min pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba mngon bar 'dod pa ma yin ba nam mkha'i yon tan ldan ba'i mi rtag pa grub pa min pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “That” refers to the non-desired [property]—the impermanence endowed with the quality of space—is not established.

original: phyed phyi ma 'chad pa ni rtog pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyed phyi ma 'chad pa ni rtog pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of the second half [of the verse] begins with “imagination. ”

original: de las de zhes bya ba rnam bar 'grel pa ni /
analyzed: de las de zhes bya ba rnam bar 'grel pa ni /
translated: The commentary on “from that” is

original: mi 'dod pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: “non-acceptance. ”

original: dam bca' ba tsam gyis 'grub na ci skyon snyam na /
analyzed: dam bca' ba tsam gyis 'grub na ci skyon snyam na /
translated: If you think, “What is wrong with establishing it by the mere thesis? ”

original: de lta na ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta na ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: [the response is:] “in that case” and so on.

original: de lta bu nyid du zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i mi rtag pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta bu nyid du zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i mi rtag pa nyid do //
translated: “In that way” refers to impermanence endowed with the quality of space.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba gzhung gis bskyed pa'i khyad bar can zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba gzhung gis bskyed pa'i khyad bar can zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: “This” does not refer to the distinctive property generated by the treatise, and so on.

original: pha rol po dag rang nyid smos pas grub ba nyid du brjod pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang /
analyzed: pha rol po dag rang nyid smos pas grub ba nyid du brjod pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang /
translated: The opponent does not say that the subject is established by itself, but

original: chos can grub pa ni bsgrub bar bya ba ma yin no zhes smra ba ni ci ste zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: chos can grub pa ni bsgrub bar bya ba ma yin no zhes smra ba ni ci ste zhes bya ba'o //
translated: he does say that the establishment of the subject is not to be proven.

original: grub pa'i mtha' pa de yang grub pa'i rang bzhin 'gog ba'i tshig nyid kyis 'grub bo zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' pa de yang grub pa'i rang bzhin 'gog ba'i tshig nyid kyis 'grub bo zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: The opponent also says that the theory is established by the very words that refute the intrinsic reality of establishment.

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid bstan pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid bstan pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is meant by “the teaching of its own nature.”

original: de zhes bya ba ni chos can bsgrub bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni chos can bsgrub bya ba yin te /
translated: The word “that” refers to the subject that is to be proven.

original: rtogs zin pas rtogs par byed pa'i 'bad pa ni 'bras bu dang bcas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtogs zin pas rtogs par byed pa'i 'bad pa ni 'bras bu dang bcas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that since it is already understood, the effort to understand it is not fruitful.

original: ci ltar 'dis rtogs snyam na 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci ltar 'dis rtogs snyam na 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: How is it understood? “In this way.”

original: rnam par gcod par bya ba med par ni khyad par don dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par gcod par bya ba med par ni khyad par don dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: Without an object of exclusion, a distinction does not have a point.

original: des na grub pa'i rang bzhin gyi chos can dang sgrub par byed pa'i rang bzhin du chos mig gis gzung ba la sogs pa bstan pa yod pa yin na rang gi ngo bo kho nar bstan pa zhes bya ba'i @60a * //
analyzed: des na grub pa'i rang bzhin gyi chos can dang sgrub par byed pa'i rang bzhin du chos mig gis gzung ba la sogs pa bstan pa yod pa yin na rang gi ngo bo kho nar bstan pa zhes bya ba'i @60a * //
translated: Therefore, if the nature of the subject and the nature of the proof were taught, such as the apprehension of the object by the eye, then it would be called “taught as just its own nature.”🔽

original: tshig 'di ni de rnam par dpyod par byed pas 'bras bu dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshig 'di ni de rnam par dpyod par byed pas 'bras bu dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if the nature of the subject and the nature of the proof are taught as being apprehended by the eye, etc., then the words “taught as just their nature” are analyzed by that, and they are fruitful.

original: de'i phyir rang nyid smos pa ni chos can bsgrub bar bya ba byed ba bzlog pa'i don du ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang nyid smos pa ni chos can bsgrub bar bya ba byed ba bzlog pa'i don du ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the mention of “itself” is not for the purpose of refuting the probandum of the subject.

original: de ni rnam pa gzhan kho nar dgag ba 'grub ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gzhan kho nar dgag ba 'grub ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is established as a negation in another way.

original: 'chad pa ni ci ste zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'chad pa ni ci ste zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “If” is explained as “what if.”

original: ci'i phyir bsgrub bya ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bsgrub bya ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not the probandum?

original: rang nyid ces smos so //
analyzed: rang nyid ces smos so //
translated: “Itself” is mentioned.

original: 'di ni rang nyid smos pa'i 'bras bu ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rang nyid smos pa'i 'bras bu ston pa'o //
translated: This shows the result of mentioning “itself.”

original: de lta ma yin na zhes rang gi ngo bo can bsgrub bar bya ba yin na'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes rang gi ngo bo can bsgrub bar bya ba yin na'o //
translated: “If it were not so” means if it were the probandum that has its own nature.

original: 'grub ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni chos can zhes bya bar blta'o //
analyzed: 'grub ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni chos can zhes bya bar blta'o //
translated: “Because of the establishment” should be supplied.

original: chos can ma grub pa ni dpyod pa mi srid pa'i phyir na chos can grub pa nyid ces bya ba ni skabs yin no //
analyzed: chos can ma grub pa ni dpyod pa mi srid pa'i phyir na chos can grub pa nyid ces bya ba ni skabs yin no //
translated: Since it is impossible to analyze what is not established, the point is that the subject must be established.

original: 'dis ni rtsod pa'i cha rnam par bkral ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni rtsod pa'i cha rnam par bkral ba yin no //
translated: This is the explanation of the parts of a dispute.

original: 'di la ni rang nyid kyis 'debs pa ni de yang mi 'thad de zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la ni rang nyid kyis 'debs pa ni de yang mi 'thad de zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here, the opponent himself says, “That is not tenable.”

original: de nyid ni zhes bya ba ni chos can grub ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni zhes bya ba ni chos can grub ba'o //
translated: “That” refers to the established subject.

original: gang bzlog pas rang nyid smos pa 'bras bu dang bcas par 'gyur pa chos can la ni bsgrub bar bya ba nyid yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang bzlog pas rang nyid smos pa 'bras bu dang bcas par 'gyur pa chos can la ni bsgrub bar bya ba nyid yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The point is that the probandum does not exist for the subject, since the reversal of that would be pointless.

original: de lta na ni zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //🔽de bzhin du rnam par dpyod pa'i yang grub pa rten ma yin no zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: de lta na ni zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o // de bzhin du rnam par dpyod pa'i yang grub pa rten ma yin no zhes 'brel to //
translated: “In that case” refers to the opponent’s position.🔽“In the same way, the established subject is not the basis of the analysis.”

original: de bzhin du grub pa yang gtan tshigs kyi rten ma yin no zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du grub pa yang gtan tshigs kyi rten ma yin no zhes sbyar ro //
translated: “In the same way, the established subject is not the basis of the reason.”

original: de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo zhes bya ba yang dgos pa dang ldan pa yin na gnyi ga yang zhes bya ba des par gzu las 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad kyi rang gi ngo bo zhes bya ba 'di yang tha
analyzed: de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo zhes bya ba yang dgos pa dang ldan pa yin na gnyi ga yang zhes bya ba des par gzu las 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad kyi rang gi ngo bo zhes bya ba 'di yang tha
translated: It is not so. If the term “own nature” has a purpose, then the term “both” would not be superfluous.

original: dad bar dgos pa dang bcas par bstan par bya bar 'gyur ba bstan pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dad bar dgos pa dang bcas par bstan par bya bar 'gyur ba bstan pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But it is not taught that this “own nature” is also to be taught as having a purpose.

original: des na rang gi ngo bo kho nas zhes bya ba 'di grub pa bsgrub par bya ba bzlog pa'i don du ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang ma grub pa'i sgrub par byed pa mig gis gzung ba nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: des na rang gi ngo bo kho nas zhes bya ba 'di grub pa bsgrub par bya ba bzlog pa'i don du ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang ma grub pa'i sgrub par byed pa mig gis gzung ba nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, this “own nature” is not for the purpose of proving what has already been proven, but rather it is for the purpose of proving what has not been proven, such as being apprehended by the eye.

original: gal te gnyi ga dgos pa dang bcas pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te gnyi ga dgos pa dang bcas pa ma yin na /
translated: If neither has a purpose,

original: 'o na ci'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: then why is it said? This is the opponent’s position.

original: 'di'i don ni 'chad pa ni ma grub pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di'i don ni 'chad pa ni ma grub pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning of this is explained in the line “what has not been proven.”

original: chos zhes bya ba ni mig gis gzung ba nyid la sogs pa ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba ni mig gis gzung ba nyid la sogs pa ma grub pa'o //
translated: “Dharma” refers to what has not been proven, such as being apprehended by the eye.

original: gal te chos ma grub pa ni sgrub par byed pa'i ngo bor bstan pa grub pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te chos ma grub pa ni sgrub par byed pa'i ngo bor bstan pa grub pa yin gyi /
translated: If an unestablished property is taught as the nature of the proof, then it is established.

original: chos can ma grub pa la grub pa'i rang bzhin du bstan pa ni ci 'dra ba zhig yin snyam na /
analyzed: chos can ma grub pa la grub pa'i rang bzhin du bstan pa ni ci 'dra ba zhig yin snyam na /
translated: But what is the nature of teaching an unestablished subject as the nature of the established?

original: dper na bdag ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dper na bdag ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: For example, “the self” is not established as having a particular.

original: khyad par dang bcas pa nyid du ma grub ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par dang bcas pa nyid du ma grub ba'o //
translated: It is not established as having a particular.

original: grub pa'i rang bzhin du bstan pa brjod pa ni /
analyzed: grub pa'i rang bzhin du bstan pa brjod pa ni /
translated: The statement of the nature of the established is

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba'o /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba'o /
translated: “in the same way.”

original: chos can gyi khyad par nyid du @60b zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos can gyi khyad par nyid du @60b zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The particular of the subject is

original: ma grub pa'i chos chos can gyi khyad par nyid du bstan pa zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: ma grub pa'i chos chos can gyi khyad par nyid du bstan pa zhes 'brel to //
translated: “not established.” The statement of the particular of the subject is connected to the unestablished property.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: “But” is the other’s.

original: mi shes pa'i rnam par brjod pa ni ci mi rtag ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi shes pa'i rnam par brjod pa ni ci mi rtag ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The expression of ignorance is “is it impermanent?”

original: lan ni sgra mtshungs kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni sgra mtshungs kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is “although the words are the same.”

original: nam mkha'i yon tan gyi sgra ni mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba'i sgra mtshungs kyang ngo //
analyzed: nam mkha'i yon tan gyi sgra ni mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba'i sgra mtshungs kyang ngo //
translated: The word “impermanent” is the same as the word “quality of space.”

original: 'di yang gzhan gyi dor brjod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di yang gzhan gyi dor brjod pa yin gyi /
translated: This is also a statement of the opponent's position.

original: sangs rgyas ba rnams kyi ltar na ni phyogs bstan par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ba rnams kyi ltar na ni phyogs bstan par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: But according to the Buddhists, it is not to be demonstrated.

original: gal te rang gi ngo bos zhes bya ba 'di la rnam par gcad bar bya ba tha dad pa khas mi len 'o na ci ltar zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi ste /
analyzed: gal te rang gi ngo bos zhes bya ba 'di la rnam par gcad bar bya ba tha dad pa khas mi len 'o na ci ltar zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi ste /
translated: If one does not accept that by own nature is a different grammatical construction, then how is it?

original: 'di rnam par gcad par bya ba nyid du brten par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di rnam par gcad par bya ba nyid du brten par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that it is not to be taken as a different grammatical construction.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: nges par gzung ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nges par gzung ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said, because of the specification.

original: de ni rnam par gcad par bya ba bstan pa'o //🔽gzhan gyi phyir zhes bya ba ni /🔽ma grub pa'i sgrub par byed pa bstan pa bsgrub par bya ba nyid du yin pa rnam par gcad ba'i phyir byas pas /
analyzed: de ni rnam par gcad par bya ba bstan pa'o // gzhan gyi phyir zhes bya ba ni / ma grub pa'i sgrub par byed pa bstan pa bsgrub par bya ba nyid du yin pa rnam par gcad ba'i phyir byas pas /
translated: That is the demonstration of the different grammatical construction.🔽For the sake of others, it is said, because of the exclusion of the probandum.

original: gzhan gyi don du yang zhes bya ba grub pa rnam par gcad pa'i yang 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don du yang zhes bya ba grub pa rnam par gcad pa'i yang 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Since it is for the sake of others, the exclusion of the probandum is also for the sake of others.

original: de skad ces bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo smos pa'i rnam par gcad par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de skad ces bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo smos pa'i rnam par gcad par bya ba'o //
translated: This is the way to state the object of exclusion by mentioning its own nature.

original: khas blangs pa sngon du song ba can gyi rnam par gcad par bya ba brjod pa'i rnam pa gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: khas blangs pa sngon du song ba can gyi rnam par gcad par bya ba brjod pa'i rnam pa gsungs pa ni /
translated: The way to state the object of exclusion by mentioning what is already accepted is stated in the line:

original: ci ste yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci ste yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “But if you say . . .”

original: grub pa bsgrub byar byed pa'o //
analyzed: grub pa bsgrub byar byed pa'o //
translated: This is to make the established the object of proof.🔽How can the statement of the object of exclusion by a statement that is not refuted by others be established as the object of proof?

original: gzhan smras pa gang gis ma bsal ba'i tshig gis rnam par gcad par bya bar 'gyur ba bsal ba mnyan par bya ba ma yin pa nyid ci ltar bsgrub bar bya ba nyid du yin par ci ltar 'thob /🔽'dir yang / gang zhig bsal kyang sgrub byed pa'i //
analyzed: gzhan smras pa gang gis ma bsal ba'i tshig gis rnam par gcad par bya bar 'gyur ba bsal ba mnyan par bya ba ma yin pa nyid ci ltar bsgrub bar bya ba nyid du yin par ci ltar 'thob / 'dir yang / gang zhig bsal kyang sgrub byed pa'i //
translated: Here one can say:🔽“There is no one who understands

original: rtogs ldan de ni 'ga' yod min //🔽med par rtogs pa de nyid ni //
analyzed: rtogs ldan de ni 'ga' yod min // med par rtogs pa de nyid ni //
translated: that which is to be established by the refutation of something else.🔽How can that very understanding of nonexistence

original: ci ltar bsgrub byang rtogs par 'gyur //
analyzed: ci ltar bsgrub byang rtogs par 'gyur //
translated: be established as the object of understanding?”

original: zhes brjod par nus pa nyid do //
analyzed: zhes brjod par nus pa nyid do //
translated: This is what can be said.

original: des na ma bsal ba'i tshig gi rnam par gcad bar bya ba bzhin du rang gi de ba'i tshig la yang gtso bo nyid du rnam par gcad pa bstan bar rigs so zhes sems pa'o //
analyzed: des na ma bsal ba'i tshig gi rnam par gcad bar bya ba bzhin du rang gi de ba'i tshig la yang gtso bo nyid du rnam par gcad pa bstan bar rigs so zhes sems pa'o //
translated: Therefore, just as the word “not” is eliminated in the expression “not a noncow,” it is proper to teach that the word “cow” is also eliminated in the expression “not a noncow.”

original: 'di la lan ni de la zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di la lan ni de la zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The response to this is as follows:

original: bsal ba la ni rtsod pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsal ba la ni rtsod pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because we see that there is a dispute about the word “not.”

original: rtsod pa mthong ba de yang phyis bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: rtsod pa mthong ba de yang phyis bstan par bya'o //
translated: And that dispute will be shown later.

original: des na rang nyid smos pa ni grub pa'i chos can bsgrub bya yin pa dgag pa'i don du ni ma yin te de lta ma yin par yang de bzlog par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //🔽rnam pa @61a * //
analyzed: des na rang nyid smos pa ni grub pa'i chos can bsgrub bya yin pa dgag pa'i don du ni ma yin te de lta ma yin par yang de bzlog par 'grub pa'i phyir ro // rnam pa @61a * //
translated: Therefore, the mention of “itself” is not for the purpose of refuting the thesis that the subject is established, because it is established even if that is not the case.🔽In another way,

original: gzhan gyis kyang chos can bsgrub par bya ba ma yin par 'grub pa khon te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis kyang chos can bsgrub par bya ba ma yin par 'grub pa khon te /
translated: it is established that the subject is not to be established.

original: de'i phyir rang nyid smos pa de'i don du ni ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang nyid smos pa de'i don du ni ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the mention of “itself” is not for that purpose.

original: rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is called “inference.”

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos khyad par du byed pa'i chos can sgra la sogs pa ni khyad par yin pas de'i yul can gyi rjes su dpag pa ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos khyad par du byed pa'i chos can sgra la sogs pa ni khyad par yin pas de'i yul can gyi rjes su dpag pa ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The subject, such as sound, which is qualified by the property to be established, is the qualifier. Therefore, there is no inference whose object is that.

original: dpe dang thun mong pa'i spyi la 'jug par gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dpe dang thun mong pa'i spyi la 'jug par gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is said that it engages a universal that is shared with an example.

original: 'on te rang nyid smos pas chos bsgrub par bya ba ma yin par bstan ba ma yin na /
analyzed: 'on te rang nyid smos pas chos bsgrub par bya ba ma yin par bstan ba ma yin na /
translated: But if it is not the case that the property to be established is indicated by the mention of itself,

original: mtshan nyid dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: then it would contradict the definition.

original: 'dir ni 'di skad ces gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dir ni 'di skad ces gsungs so //
translated: Here, this is said:

original: phyogs kyi mtshan nyid 'dir ni /
analyzed: phyogs kyi mtshan nyid 'dir ni /
translated: The definition of the subject🔽is not the property to be established.

original: chos can bsgrub par bya ba ma yin no zhes rang nyid smos pas de skad ma brjod kyang 'gal ba cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: chos can bsgrub par bya ba ma yin no zhes rang nyid smos pas de skad ma brjod kyang 'gal ba cung zad kyang med do //
translated: Even though it is not stated in that way by the mention of itself, there is not the slightest contradiction.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni spyi'i yul can nyid kyis chos can bsgrub bya ma yin par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni spyi'i yul can nyid kyis chos can bsgrub bya ma yin par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because inference is understood to be not the property to be established, since it has a universal for its object.

original: 'on te chos can yang spyi kho na yin ba des na bsgrub par bya par thal lo snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te chos can yang spyi kho na yin ba des na bsgrub par bya par thal lo snyam na /
translated: But if the subject is a universal, then the probandum follows.

original: chos can zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: chos can zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The subject is that which is to be established.

original: de las gzhan ni ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan ni ma grub pa'o //
translated: The other is not established.

original: ci'i phyir skyon yod pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir skyon yod pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is there no fault?

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: The specific property is that which is to be established.

original: gzhan yang chos can bsgrub bar bya ba yin na gtan tshigs kyi nyes ba nyid yin gyi phyogs kyi nyes ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang chos can bsgrub bar bya ba yin na gtan tshigs kyi nyes ba nyid yin gyi phyogs kyi nyes ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, if the subject is to be established, then there is a fault in the reason, but not a fault in the position.

original: des na de ni phyogs kyi mtshan nyid kho nas spangs pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na de ni phyogs kyi mtshan nyid kho nas spangs pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that it is not excluded by the definition of the position.

original: rjes 'gro med pa nyid ni gtan tshigs kyi skyon yin gyi phyogs kyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes 'gro med pa nyid ni gtan tshigs kyi skyon yin gyi phyogs kyi ni ma yin no //
translated: The absence of pervasion is a fault in the reason, but not in the position.

original: des na de'i skyon ni de'i mtshan nyid kho nas spang bar bya ba yin zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: des na de'i skyon ni de'i mtshan nyid kho nas spang bar bya ba yin zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: Therefore, it is said that its fault is to be excluded by its definition.

original: 'di nyid zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'di nyid zhes smos so //
translated: It is said this itself.

original: rjes su 'gro ba med pa dang / bsgrub par bya ba ma tshang ba'i rang bzhin ni /🔽gtan tshigs dang dpe dag gi'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba med pa dang / bsgrub par bya ba ma tshang ba'i rang bzhin ni / gtan tshigs dang dpe dag gi'o //
translated: The nature of the reason and example is the absence of concomitance and the incompleteness of the probandum.

original: gtan tshigs la sogs ltos ba zhes bya ba ni ma grub pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gtan tshigs la sogs ltos ba zhes bya ba ni ma grub pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The so-called “dependence on the reason, etc.” refers to the characteristics of the unestablished, etc.

original: ha cang thal ba 'di'i lan gyi dgos pa ni 'on te dper na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ha cang thal ba 'di'i lan gyi dgos pa ni 'on te dper na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The purpose of the reply to this absurd consequence is stated in the phrase “for example. . . .”

original: gtan tshigs gzhan gyi zhes bya ba ni byas pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: gtan tshigs gzhan gyi zhes bya ba ni byas pa la sogs pas so //
translated: The phrase “another reason” refers to such things as being produced.

original: de ltar gang la gtan tshigs gzhan yod pa der ni gtan tshigs kyi skyon nyid yin no zhes rnam par bzhag nas gang du gtan tshigs 'ga' yang med par der ni phyogs kho na'i nyes pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar gang la gtan tshigs gzhan yod pa der ni gtan tshigs kyi skyon nyid yin no zhes rnam par bzhag nas gang du gtan tshigs 'ga' yang med par der ni phyogs kho na'i nyes pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: Thus, having established that where there is another reason, that is a fault of the reason, he states that where there is no reason at all, that is a fault of the thesis alone.

original: gang du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase “wherever . . .”

original: chos can @61b rang gi mtshan nyid bsgrub par bya ba la ni gtan tshigs 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos can @61b rang gi mtshan nyid bsgrub par bya ba la ni gtan tshigs 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the proof of the particular characteristic of the subject, there is no reason at all, because there is no concomitance.

original: des na 'di ni phyogs kyi nyes pa kho na'o zhes ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: des na 'di ni phyogs kyi nyes pa kho na'o zhes ci ltar zhe na /
translated: Therefore, how can it be said that this is only a fault of the position?

original: srid pa'i rang gi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i rang gi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word “own” is supplied.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni rang gi bsam pa'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni rang gi bsam pa'o //
translated: “ That” refers to one’s own opinion.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni chos rjes su mi 'gro bas na thams cad du sgrub par byed pa mi srid pas na'o //🔽chos can gyi rang bzhin phyogs kyi mi srid pa 'di nyid 'di ci gtan tshigs la ltos nas sam /
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni chos rjes su mi 'gro bas na thams cad du sgrub par byed pa mi srid pas na'o // chos can gyi rang bzhin phyogs kyi mi srid pa 'di nyid 'di ci gtan tshigs la ltos nas sam /
translated: “ Therefore” means that because the property is not established, it is impossible to establish anything.

original: 'on te gzhan la ltos pa med par rang la gnas pa nyid yin /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan la ltos pa med par rang la gnas pa nyid yin /
translated: Does this very impossibility of the property of the subject depend on the reason, or does it reside in itself without depending on anything else?

original: ci ltar na de gnyi ga yang ma yin snyam na /
analyzed: ci ltar na de gnyi ga yang ma yin snyam na /
translated: How can it be that neither of these two is the case?

original: gal te rtags dang zhes bya ba'i'o //
analyzed: gal te rtags dang zhes bya ba'i'o //
translated: If it is said that the reason is the fault,

original: rjes su 'gro ba med pa la sogs pa de ni /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba med pa la sogs pa de ni /
translated: then the absence of pervasion, etc.

original: rtags kyi skyon nyid yin pa'i phyogs kyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rtags kyi skyon nyid yin pa'i phyogs kyi ni ma yin no //
translated: is a fault of the reason, not of the position.

original: 'on te nyes pa gang zhig gtan tshigs la ltos pa de ni rang la brten ba nyid yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te nyes pa gang zhig gtan tshigs la ltos pa de ni rang la brten ba nyid yin no snyam na /
translated: But if it is thought that any fault that depends on the reason resides in itself,

original: de ni zhes smos te /
analyzed: de ni zhes smos te /
translated: then the word “that” is supplied.

original: gtan tshigs kyi skyon ni'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi skyon ni'o //
translated: The fault of the reason is stated.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: mthong pa yis kyang zhes smos so //
analyzed: mthong pa yis kyang zhes smos so //
translated: Because of the statement “even by perception.”

original: chos can de 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos can de 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the establishment of that subject.

original: gtan tshigs kyi tshig 'di nyid ni /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi tshig 'di nyid ni /
translated: This very statement of the reason is

original: gal te rang gi rang bzhin gyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te rang gi rang bzhin gyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “if it has its own nature.”

original: dogs pa ni rjes su dpag pas mngon sum du gyur pa'i phyogs mi 'grub po zhe na /
analyzed: dogs pa ni rjes su dpag pas mngon sum du gyur pa'i phyogs mi 'grub po zhe na /
translated: The doubt is that the position that is manifest by inference is not established.

original: lan 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is “Well then.”

original: gal te mngon sum gyis grub kyang /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum gyis grub kyang /
translated: Even if it is established by perception,

original: grub pa la sgrub pa nyid kyi phyogs kyi skyon ma yin nam snyam na /
analyzed: grub pa la sgrub pa nyid kyi phyogs kyi skyon ma yin nam snyam na /
translated: isn’t it a fault of the position that it is established by a proof?

original: grub pa la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: grub pa la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is “In that case.”

original: 'o na phyogs kyi skyon gang yin snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na phyogs kyi skyon gang yin snyam na /
translated: Well then, what is the fault of the position?

original: de ni zhes smos te /🔽grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon ni /
analyzed: de ni zhes smos te / grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon ni /
translated: The response is “That.”🔽The fault of establishing what is already established

original: der yang bdag nyid kho na'i mngon sum gyis grub pa la gtan tshigs kyi skyon yin zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: der yang bdag nyid kho na'i mngon sum gyis grub pa la gtan tshigs kyi skyon yin zhes 'brel to //
translated: is a fault of the reason in the establishment by one’s own perception of that.

original: rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba gnyi ga'i mngon sum gyis grub pa la ni zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba gnyi ga'i mngon sum gyis grub pa la ni zhes 'brel to //
translated: “Both parties” refers to the proponent and the opponent.

original: rjes su dpag pa grub pa bzhin du lung gis grub pa yang phyogs yin no snyam na /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa grub pa bzhin du lung gis grub pa yang phyogs yin no snyam na /
translated: If you think that, like an established inference, an established scriptural citation is a premise,

original: lung gis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lung gis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then there is “scriptural citation.”

original: ci ltar mngon sum gyis grub pa la rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir phyogs ma yin pa de bzhin du lung gis grub pa yang ngo //
analyzed: ci ltar mngon sum gyis grub pa la rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir phyogs ma yin pa de bzhin du lung gis grub pa yang ngo //
translated: Just as what is established by perception is not a premise because it does not follow, so too it is with what is established by scriptural citation.

original: pha rol po dag dpe dang don dag chos mi mtshungs par brjod pa ni /
analyzed: pha rol po dag dpe dang don dag chos mi mtshungs par brjod pa ni /
translated: The opponent says that the example and the meaning are not similar.

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “If” is the statement.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is it?

original: lung gi yul ni zhes smras so //
analyzed: lung gi yul ni zhes smras so //
translated: “The domain of scriptural citation” is stated.

original: lan ni 'di nyid ces bya ba'o //🔽brjod pa'i rnam pa gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: lan ni 'di nyid ces bya ba'o // brjod pa'i rnam pa gsungs pa ni /
translated: The answer is “this very thing.”

original: gtan tshigs kyi zhes bya ba'o //🔽lung las grub pa la ni de tsam @62a * //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi zhes bya ba'o // lung las grub pa la ni de tsam @62a * //
translated: The statement of the form is “the reason.”🔽In what is established by scriptural citation, there is just that much.

original: las gyur pa nyid med pa khon te /
analyzed: las gyur pa nyid med pa khon te /
translated: There is no more than that.

original: das na ci ltar phyogs nyid ma yin snyam na /
analyzed: das na ci ltar phyogs nyid ma yin snyam na /
translated: Therefore, how can it not be a premise?

original: 'di la yang zhes bya ba ste lung las grub ba yang ngo //
analyzed: 'di la yang zhes bya ba ste lung las grub ba yang ngo //
translated: Here also, and so on means that it is established by scriptural tradition.

original: phyogs tsam las gyur pa nyid ston pa ni /🔽'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyogs tsam las gyur pa nyid ston pa ni / 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The mere indication of the side is thus.

original: de ni phyogs so //
analyzed: de ni phyogs so //
translated: That is the side.

original: gang gis de sgrub pa nyid kyi phyogs su 'gyur ba gtan tshigs kyis ci dgos /
analyzed: gang gis de sgrub pa nyid kyi phyogs su 'gyur ba gtan tshigs kyis ci dgos /
translated: What is the need for a reason to establish that as the side?

original: gzhan la ni phyir rgol ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan la ni phyir rgol ba'o //
translated: The other is the opponent.

original: rang nyid kyi rgol ba'o //
analyzed: rang nyid kyi rgol ba'o //
translated: One's own is the proponent.

original: lung las grub pa phyogs yin no zhes bya ba skabs yin no //
analyzed: lung las grub pa phyogs yin no zhes bya ba skabs yin no //
translated: The established by scriptural tradition is the side, this is the context.

original: gnyi ga la yang zhes bya ba ni rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba la'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga la yang zhes bya ba ni rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba la'o //
translated: Both refers to the proponent and opponent.

original: gal te lung las grub ba phyogs ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te lung las grub ba phyogs ma yin na /
translated: If the established by scriptural tradition is not the side,

original: 'o na gang phyogs yin snyam na de'i phyir zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'o na gang phyogs yin snyam na de'i phyir zhes smos so //
translated: then what is the side? Therefore, it is said then.

original: des zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyi rang bzhin gyis so //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyi rang bzhin gyis so //
translated: By that means by the nature of the distinction.

original: de ni spyi'o //
analyzed: de ni spyi'o //
translated: That is the general.

original: gal te de ltar na zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas zhe na'i bar ni rtsod pa'o //
analyzed: gal te de ltar na zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas zhe na'i bar ni rtsod pa'o //
translated: If so, from here up to then what? is the dispute.

original: des ma grub pa ni mngon sum gyis ma grub pa la rjes su dpag pa shin tu yang med par 'gyur te zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: des ma grub pa ni mngon sum gyis ma grub pa la rjes su dpag pa shin tu yang med par 'gyur te zhes 'brel to //
translated: The meaning of “not established” is that if it is not established by perception, it is also not established by inference.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rjes su dpag pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Inference is like that.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rtsod pa gnyis pa brjod pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rtsod pa gnyis pa brjod pa'o //
translated: The second objection is stated by “Likewise, . . .” and so on.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gnod pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gnod pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: He says, “If it is undermined.”

original: de la re zhig rtsod ba dang po sel ba ni /
analyzed: de la re zhig rtsod ba dang po sel ba ni /
translated: First, the response to the first objection is this:

original: rjes su dpag pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Inference is like that.

original: 'o na ci ltar mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba can yin snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba can yin snyam na /
translated: Well, how is it that it is preceded by perception?

original: 'on kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He says, “Nevertheless, . . .”

original: de'i zhes bya ba spyi'i bsal pa de'i yul can gyi mngon sum gang yin pa de med na der rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa ma yin no zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba spyi'i bsal pa de'i yul can gyi mngon sum gang yin pa de med na der rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa ma yin no zhes 'brel to //
translated: The object of that is the object of the perception that is the object of that. If that does not exist, inference does not engage that object.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rjes su dpag pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Inference is like that.

original: me la sogs pa'i spyi de'i bsal ba ste rang gi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de la mngon sum 'jug pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me la sogs pa'i spyi de'i bsal ba ste rang gi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de la mngon sum 'jug pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the direct perception of the individual characteristic of that universal, fire, etc. is what precedes it.

original: spyi'i mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba can nyid la nyes pa ci yod snyam na /
analyzed: spyi'i mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba can nyid la nyes pa ci yod snyam na /
translated: What is wrong with the fact that direct perception of the universal precedes it?

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is,

original: spyi dang rjes su dpag pas ci bya ste khyad par med pa'i spyi ni mngon sum kho nas grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi dang rjes su dpag pas ci bya ste khyad par med pa'i spyi ni mngon sum kho nas grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: what is the use of the universal and inference, since the universal, which is devoid of distinctions, is established by direct perception alone?

original: gang la mngon sum du mi 'jug pa'i spyi'ang gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang la mngon sum du mi 'jug pa'i spyi'ang gang yin zhe na /
translated: And what is that universal which direct perception does not engage?

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ces smos so //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ces smos so //
translated: The individual characteristic is mentioned.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: khyad par du ma rtogs pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par du ma rtogs pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because it is not the apprehension of the manifold.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa des na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa des na /
translated: And since that is so,

original: mngon sum gyi yul la rjes su dpag pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don kyang 'di nyid yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi yul la rjes su dpag pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don kyang 'di nyid yin no //
translated: this is the meaning of the statement, “Inference does not have a real universal for its object.”

original: rang yin zhe na /
analyzed: rang yin zhe na /
translated: If it is real,

original: @62b rjes su dpag pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: @62b rjes su dpag pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then it is inference.

original: de ni zhes bya ba brjod ma thag pa'i rang bzhin gyi spyi'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba brjod ma thag pa'i rang bzhin gyi spyi'o //
translated: “That” refers to the previously mentioned universal of intrinsic nature.

original: 'o na ci ltar rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs she na /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs she na /
translated: But how is the particular known?

original: me ni zhes bya ba ste rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: me ni zhes bya ba ste rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: “Fire” refers to the particular of intrinsic nature.

original: gal te spyi mngon sum gyis ma bzung na /
analyzed: gal te spyi mngon sum gyis ma bzung na /
translated: If the universal is not apprehended by perception,

original: khyab ba rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ci ltar rjes su dpag snyam na /
analyzed: khyab ba rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ci ltar rjes su dpag snyam na /
translated: how can it be inferred, since the pervasion is not known?

original: kun du tha snyad pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar brjod zin pa yin no //
analyzed: kun du tha snyad pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar brjod zin pa yin no //
translated: It was previously stated that “it is known through conventional cognition.”

original: 'dis ni rtsod pa dang po bsal te /
analyzed: 'dis ni rtsod pa dang po bsal te /
translated: This resolves the first objection.

original: gnyis pa sel ba brjod pa ni /🔽phyogs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa sel ba brjod pa ni / phyogs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The second objection is stated:🔽“The universal is not apprehended by perception, because it is not a particular.”

original: 'di nyid de zhes bya ba ni brjod ma thag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid de zhes bya ba ni brjod ma thag pa'o //
translated: This is the same as what was just said.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: de las bzlog pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Because it is the opposite of that.”

original: gal te gang gis phyogs la mngon sum gyis gnod par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: gal te gang gis phyogs la mngon sum gyis gnod par 'gyur ba /
translated: If the universal is not apprehended by perception, because it is not a particular, how can the particular be invalidated by perception?

original: bsal ba gnod pas spyi gnod par ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /🔽gang la zhes bya ba'o /
analyzed: bsal ba gnod pas spyi gnod par ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /🔽gang la zhes bya ba'o /
translated: How can the universal be invalidated by the invalidation of the particular?🔽“That which is invalidated by perception is not a universal.”

original: bkag pa ci ltar sel snyam na /
analyzed: bkag pa ci ltar sel snyam na /
translated: If you think that the negation is removed in the same way,

original: bkag pa bzlog pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bkag pa bzlog pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the reversal of the negation is also.

original: mnyan bya bkag pa sel ba yang mnyan bya'i mtshan nyid kyi yul gang bkag pa mnyan bya ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba mnyan par bya ba nyid de nyid kyi sgo nas mnyan bya ma yin pa bzlog pa yin gyi /
analyzed: mnyan bya bkag pa sel ba yang mnyan bya'i mtshan nyid kyi yul gang bkag pa mnyan bya ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba mnyan par bya ba nyid de nyid kyi sgo nas mnyan bya ma yin pa bzlog pa yin gyi /
translated: The removal of the negation of the object of hearing is the object of the characteristic of the object of hearing, which is the reversal of the non-object of hearing through the very means of being the object of hearing.

original: dgag pa'i yul mnyan bya nyid las gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dgag pa'i yul mnyan bya nyid las gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not by any other means than the object of hearing itself.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzhan ni de dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //🔽gal te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni de dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro // gal te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: Because the other is not in contradiction with it.

original: mngon sum du gyur pa'i don de ni rjes su dpag pa dang sgra dag gi yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
